subject: test cases problem
content: When running my test cases, for some reason after the block of code is run, after it reaches the end parenthesis of the unit test block, my code always executes the pop_front() function. What is the reason for this? My test case should be passing, but because of the execution of the pop_front function unnecessarily errors are happening. subject: Project 3 grade question
content: Hello!. . My name is Gillian and my uniquename is jamesgil. I'm asking this question on Piazza because all instructors are on here and I'm not sure who predominantly deals with grading, but my enrolled instructor is Somayeh Molaei. Essentially, I want to ask if there's any way I can get any leniency in my Project 3 grade. I wouldn't normally ask for something like this, but I figured asking can't hurt, and I completely understand if 'no' is the flat answer.. . Basically, I'm feeling a bit screwed over by my partner for project 3 (uniquename jqnewman). We met in the first week after the project spec was posted and stubbed functions together, and throughout the project after that they were very unreliable. They seemed to have no availability to work on the project and took no initiative in the project for the first 2 weeks, and they did not respond to my texts often when asking if they could work on the project or if they could meet up. I proceeded to essentially write the entirety of Card.cpp, Card_Tests.cpp, Pack.cpp, Player.cpp, Player_tests.cpp on my own. The only thing my partner helped with was the shuffle() function in pack (which they wrote an implementation for, but it was not tested and did not work, so I had to finish writing it and testing it anyways), and they pasted the player_factory() outline from the project spec into player.cpp. They told me they would "pull their weight" during the final week of the project, and I had exams during the first part of that week so I chose to rely on her to begin the driver function. They were adament that working virtually worked better for them, so we did not meet in person. They did not start working until Thursday night, while I was finishing up player_tests.cpp, and then proceeded to tell me they finished writing the entire driver function! I thought, great, its at least close to done! However, when we tried to finalize things on Friday, our euchre.cpp was SO full of bugs and irregular behavior, and also did not account for a lot of the edge cases, so of course it was failing the tests. It took us all our time together Friday (which was limited because we both had classes, and she had IA office hours from 6:30 to 8) just to get the driver to compile, and by then we did not have enough time to fully debug before turning the project in. Also, all our style points were lost to euchre.cpp (which you can see in the autograder), which was, for lack of a better phrase, coded like an absolute mess. . . Basically, I'm frustrated because i put a lot of work into carefully coding and testing all the helper function files, and it feels like a lot of that work has been lost because our driver function is an absolute mess, and one that I did not have enough time or notice to work through. Further, all the points in our final autograder submission were achieved from the files that I implemented, essentially by myself (Card.cpp, Card_tests.cpp, Player.cpp, Player_tests.cpp, Pack.cpp). Its generally disappointing because I was really looking forward to successfully coding a working euchre.cpp file, and I feel like the lack of planning, communication, and, imbalance of work on my partner's end prevented us from doing this. Arguably, I could have taken further initiative earlier on in the project and set us up for more success, but this was difficult to do when I felt bad for 'overtaking' the project, doing more than my fair share of work, and doing more work without her affirmation or thoughts (since getting a response from her was very difficult).  . . Without a doubt, I think its valid to assert that this poor project grade is a reflection of both my partner and I's lack of organization, but I can't help but feel that this lack of organization was very one-sided, and made it exceptionally more difficult for me to maintain an agenda that would lead to success. (ie, if I had done the project by myself, I could have made myself a schedule and followed it without being limited by another person's lack of organization and reliability). Regardless, I want to emphasize that I understand if there's absolutely no changes to my project grade that can be made, but I figured I would at least explain my situation, and see if there's any possible resolution. Thank you (and I'm sorry to make you read such a long piazza post)! Please let me know if there's anyone I can reach out to directly about this issue!
i_answer: Dear Gillian,. I'm very sorry to hear about your poor partnership experience. I feel your frustration and appreciate all the hard work you have put in this project. However this case of bad partnership happens often, unfortunately  there is nothing we can do to change your score. I would like to look at the bright side of things at the times of disappointment and remember not getting your desired score  for one project would not prevent you from gaining a great final score in this course. . I would be more than happy to talk to you more in person if that helps. . . Regards,. . Somayeh Molaei

subject: bad access
content: i am getting a bad access error when i am going through the euchre01 test. it is happening on the third hand on the second person who wants to pass and i'm confused because it worked for hand 1 and 2 and at the start of 3. I don't know where to go to figure out whats wrong. any advice would be appreciated!. .
i_answer: Based on this snippet, the dangerous part seems like `players[dealer_index + i]`, where players is probably an array/vector of size 4, dealer_index is the index in that array of the current dealer, and i is some for-loop variable to go across the next four players. This seems dangerous because we may not be checking whether dealer_index + i is a valid index into our players array - consider when dealer_index = 2 (so player 3 is now dealing), if i = 0, 1, 2, 3 then dealer_index + i = 2, 3, 4, 5 which mean we would be accessing invalid indices of our players array (4 and 5).. . To fix this, consider using the modulo operator - recall that it gives you the remainder when dividing two numbers. For example, 7 % 4 = 3. The nice part about modulo is that it's often used to make sure a number fits into a certain range. Say we had numbers 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 ..., if we did % 4 on each of them, then we get 0 1 2 3 0 1 2 3 0 ... - notice that now all numbers are between 0 and 3. So, its sort of lets us loop back around when a number gets too big for our range

subject: Style checking Function Length
content: What exactly is this checking for? I thought at first its line limit, but I only have 30 lines but it said i have 50. Does this not allow me to combine multiple statements on a single line?
i_answer: It does not count combined statements as one line of code. For example, on line 91 of euchre.cpp, you have:. . . if (((hand+1) % 4) % 2 == 0) {t1order = true;} else {t2order = true;}. . which counts as four lines of code because this is essentially:. . . if (((hand+1) % 4) % 2 == 0) {. 	t1order = true; . } else {. 	t2order = true;}

subject: Newlines

If trump is made in round 1, then the dealer needs to pick up the upcard and choose which card to discard.. . If trump is made in round 2, then there is no adding and discarding of the upcard

subject: Long Functions Euchre
content: oclint -no-analytics -rule=HighNcssMethod -rc=NCSS_METHOD=40 -max-priority-1 0 -max-priority-2 0 -max-priority-3 0 Card.cpp Pack.cpp Player.cpp euchre.cpp -- -xc++ --std=c++11. . . OCLint Report. . Summary: TotalFiles=4 FilesWithViolations=1 P1=0 P2=1 P3=0 . . /home/autograder/working_dir/euchre.cpp:13:1: high ncss method [size|P2] Method of 180 non-commenting source statements exceeds limit of 40. . [OCLint (http://oclint.org) v0.13]. Makefile:126: recipe for target 'style-oclint-functions' failed. . . . How do I fix this?
i_answer: You have 180 statements (i think that means things that end in semicolons) in one of your functions, but you're only allowed to have 40. To fix the error you'll probably have to make more functions to hold the other lines.

subject: I've used all three submits but my only errors were whitespace
content: Hi, today I used my final submit after finally getting all the cards to print out in the right order for all the public tests. I still failed the euchre.cpp public tests in the autograder for two reasons:. . 1) I didn't skip a line after printing the winners of the game. I did this because I was following the spec meticulously as we are told to do. For example, the spec is very detailed in telling us when to print new lines: "If a march occurs, print march! followed by a newline.", and "Print an extra newline when making, adding, and discarding is complete." However, the instructions to print the winners are simply "When the game is over, print the winners of the game." Since adding a newline wasn't mentioned, I didn't add it to my code but the autograders correct output has a newline.. . 2) In a case where both a march and a euchre occur, my code prints out "march!" but the autograder prints out "euchred!" The spec did not mention which to display in the case where both are true. . . Essentially, my code fully works except for a couple of very tiny syntax issues. It is complete before the 8:00 pm deadline, but I can't get full points because I can't submit after I've submitted three times. Last year, we had hidden submits after our first three submits were scored. We could still submit our code to be graded, we just couldn't see our grades. I feel this makes sense seeing as my euchre tests are failing due to unmentioned details in the spec.. . my uniqname is abloem

subject: Euchre.cpp errors
content: Screenshot_(106).png. . I keep getting this error when I make euchre.cpp, and my partner and I don't know how to fix it. Could someone help interpret it?
i_answer: Hey - really sorry we're only getting this answered after the project deadline, I know that's really frustrating. That is a really confusing error, but I think the most useful bit is all the way at the bottom where it says:. ```. "invalid new-expression of abstract class type Player" . ```. Remember that we can't instantiate instances of an abstract class (a class which has pure virtual functions i.e. virtual functions that are set to 0, such as in Player.h) - you should be careful you're not trying to construct any instances of Player. Also, you need to make sure you override any pure virtual functions in derived classes, otherwise those would become abstract classes as well and you can't instantiate them either

subject: Two players add the upcard
content: . . For some reason the upcard is being added twice, once to the person ordering up, and once to the dealer. This happens whenever make_trump is true in the first round, and we made sure that only the dealer adds the upcard whenver someone orders up in round 1.. . We have been working at this bug for 2 hours and don't know how to solve it. Any help would be much appreciated.
i_answer: Since the dealer is supposed to add the upcard, maybe step through and make sure that you're not calling add_and_discard on the dealer, then changing the dealer, and then calling add_and_discard for that person as well in the same hand. Also, check your other hands and see if the dealer and the player after the dealer are picking up the card too. Like in hand 1, Edsger and Fran are next to each other. Check if the dealer and the dealer+1 players both pick up the upcard in the other hands too. That might help you find a pattern and narrow down what/where the error is.

subject: autograder says that I have an undefined reference to a helper function
content: I wrote a helper function in player.cpp and wanted to use it in euchre.cpp, so I declared it again at the top of euchre since its implementation is in player.cpp, however, in Autograder, for Euchre Public Tests with Solution Card, Player, Pack setup it says I have an "undefined reference to" my function, I tried just copying the implementation over to euchre, which works, but then I lose points for code duplication. How do I fix this?
i_answer: I am not sure due to the lack of details but what I think is happening is,. . 1) you declared the helper function again inside euchre.cpp with a different name, and you used that helper function (in euchre.cpp) on a player pointer.. 2) Or, you are using that function on a different type of object rather than a player pointer.. . If 1) is the case, the compiler will look inside player.cpp to find that function, but it's not there.. If 2) is the case, the compiler will look inside that object's class definition, and it's not there.. . In order to solve this, just access the original helper function that you wrote in player.cpp through a player pointer, if that is what you intend; doing something with your players in euchre.cpp.. Moreover, the helper function you're trying to access in player.cpp should be public + not declared as static in order to use it outside player.cpp.

subject: Where should I print out a blank line

i_answer: Sorry we’re only just getting to your question after the project deadline has passed, I know that’s pretty frustrating. To answer your question at least, the new lines do factor into the correctness on the autograder and I believe would affect the final grading, so you should take care to match the sample output given in the starter files as closely as you can. For newlines, that would mean having a blank line after ordering up, between each trick, and after the end of each hand - I may have missed something, but I believe that’s everywhere you would’ve needed a blank line. . edit: nevermind! I forgot about the line in the spec here, which Xianzhi appropriately mentioned in the followups: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#hints-for-system-testing.

subject: euchre cout
content: Are we only supposed to print the output of our hands during hand 0, like how the specs say in appendix B?
i_answer: You should print Hand x at the beginning of each hand, and when played by a human player, you should print all the cards the player currently has when this player needs to lead, play, or discard a card.

subject: how to determine next leader
content: My partner and I are stumped about how to assign the new leader after a trick has been won based on who played the winning card. How can we keep track of which player played which card and which team they are on in order to correctly assign points to the right team and also determine the leader of the next trick? Thanks!
i_answer: Maybe you could create a Player* variable that stores the player who has played the highest card in the trick, and update it as necessary throughout the trick?. . As for keeping track of what team the winning player belongs to, I'm not sure. The solution to that would likely involve computing the correct index of the std::vector that stores your players somehow.

subject: Header difference between autograder and terminal
content: This is the only difference between the autograder and my output. Was there something i was supposed to cout that i missed?. . .
i_answer: You need to print what is input into the command line. It’s stated in the spec I believe.

subject: Running Euchre00- doesn't get problems until trick 3
content: I'm really confused on whether the incorrect lines reflect problems with player.cpp (and specifically play_card and lead_card) or with the driver function. I highlighted in red everything that is showing up incorrectly..
i_answer: It's kind of tough to say - when players are playing incorrect cards, it really could be a couple different things. Maybe players aren't getting the right cards to begin with, or the player strategy has a bug somewhere like you mentioned, or trump/led suit isn't being stored properly in your driver program - so again, lot of different causes. Using your debugger is probably the best method to figure where exactly things are going wrong, so just stepping through your program until you find the code doing something weird (a value not set right, taking an unexpected branch in your code, etc.). It would be a reasonable guess to start looking at play_card and lead_card though.. . Another option is to write a small test case to simulate the situation at the start of the trick where things are going wrong - for example, give Adi the cards they should have at the beginning of trick 3, then ask them to play a card based on trump and the led suit for that trick. That's another way you can narrow down where the problem could be

i_answer: If every tests pass and every output matches in euchre.cpp and doesn't throw any errors by running on Valgrind, I think so.. But just to make sure, I've seen posts people saying that there were no errors on Valgrind but AG throwed errors regarding Valgrind, so maybe check out those posts before submitting you project on AG.. Just to make sure, since we only have 3 submissions left at this point.

subject: Play Card
content: For simple player strategy for play card. Say if the lead card suit was diamonds and the player has a jack of diamonds. Would that player play the jack of diamonds, since it follows suit? This is the third round in hand one in euchre_test01.out.correct.. King of Diamonds led by EdsgerNine of Spades played by FranNine of Clubs played by GabrielQueen of Diamonds played by HerbEdsger takes the trick. For example for this round, Gabriel has a Jack of Diamonds, wouldn't he play that card to follow the lead card suit of diamonds?
i_answer: Depends on what trump is - I'm assuming here trump is hearts, in which case the Jack of Diamonds would technically be a heart because it's the left bower

subject: weriod index
content: I try to read an index of the card in by cin. but I got this error. Does anyone knows how to deal with it?.
i_answer: maybe because the number is not initialized before an user inputs an integer, the number will be a random integer. As you can see, the compiler is initializing the number to 32766, which will clearly get out of bounds of the cards vector.

subject: Pass by const reference when appropriate
content: Will we lose points if we have any functions where we do not have the const keyword where it would be appropriate?
i_answer: In my opinion, I don't think so because in previous projects I didn't declare variables that are constant throughout the program to be constant, but I didn't lose any points.. By declaring something constant when you know that you should not modify its value, you will be guaranteed that you don't modify it by mistake because the compiler will throw an error if you do so. So it just prevents mistakes.

subject: Sigabrt "terminating with uncaught exception of type std::invalid_argument: stoi: no conversion"
content: When I try to run euchre.cpp i get this error. . "terminating with uncaught exception of type std::invalid_argument: stoi: no conversion" How do I fix this?
i_answer: Try using atoi instead of stoi. Also, make sure that argv[3] is holding the thing you think it is (if you're not passing the correct arguments, stoi could fail).

subject: Trump suit and led card
content: If the current trump suit is heart, and the led card is Jack of Diamonds, so would playing hearts cards be regarded as following suit?
i_answer: In this case the Jack of Diamonds becomes the Jack of Hearts because Jack of Diamonds is a left bower and left bowers technically have the same suit as the trump. So yes, playing hearts would be following suit..

content: I keep trying to run the simple public tests given for euchre, but every time I do, I get this message, what does it mean? . .

I would look for vectors you are accessing near this code (perhaps a vector of Cards or Players) and see if you could be accessing an index that is out of bounds of the array. Stepping through this code using a visual debugger would likely help you identify the vector and invalid index.

subject: Why does Fran not play the lowest card in her hand here?
content: Why is Fran, who's hand at this point includes the Nine of Diamonds and the Ten of Spades, supposed to play Nine of Diamonds here when Diamonds is the trump suit (this is hand 1 of euchre_test01 btw) and therefore greater than the ten of spades? The simple player strategy says "If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand.". .
i_answer: I think it’s because the led suit is the trump suit (left bower), so Fran plays diamonds in order to follow suit. You can also check out @1950 for more explanation

subject: Debugger closes before command line arguments.
content: The debugger opens but doesn't allow me to type in the arguments. Therefore, it reads nothing and then closes automatically. .
i_answer: In order to run your debugger with command line arguments, you'll need to modify the debugger settings so it starts the debugger with those args - I don't think you're able to enter them yourself after the debugger has started running. It depends on which IDE you're using, but here are the guides for each of them on how to configure your debugger with arguments:. . 1. VSCode: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_vscode.html#arguments-and-options. 2. XCode: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_xcode.html#arguments-and-options. 3. Visual Studio: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p1-stats/setup_visualstudio.html#arguments-and-options

subject: Debugging Human Tests
content: How are we supposed to be debugging for human tests for euchre.cpp? Everytime I hit a cin statement my debugger just stops.
i_answer: See this part of the spec for testing human players: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#hints-for-system-testing. The main idea is that you can run your euchre program with human players using file redirection with euchre_test50.in to simulate a human player entering those commands (rather than having to enter input yourself). The reason your debugger stops at cin statements is because its expecting input, and can't continue until it receives something - if you use file redirection, you can avoid this problem. Otherwise, you would have to open the terminal the debugger is using and input something manually everytime you reach a cin statement

subject: Error with Player.cpp
content: Can someone help explain this error to me?.
i_answer: Usually in Visual Studio, if the error code on the left starts with "LNK", its some sort of compile/linking error - it looks like in this case its having trouble with your hand member variable in Human and Simple. If your most recent autograder submission is up to date, its possibly because you've declared the hand member variable as static. Remember that static member variables are variables that are shared across all instances of that class - in other words, the hand being static means every Simple player would share the same hand, when they should each have their own hands. I would try removing the static keyword, and hopefully that fixes the visual studio issues you're having

subject: Debugging Error in VSCode?

i_answer: Okay so just in case anyone else was getting this error, I fixed it by taking the first argument "./euchre.exe" out of the list of args in launch.json (which was a mistake on my part), but I also had to install codelldb extensions for vscode because of some weird debugging errors due to my MacBook having the M1 chip (I think?). If anyone else has trouble just try a few different extensions for lldb and it should work.

subject: test euchre
content: I tried testing euchre by typing . . $ ./euchre.exe pack.in noshuffle 3 Ivan Human Judea Human Kunle Human Liskov Human < euchre_test50.in > euchre_test50.out. $ sdiff -B euchre_test50.out euchre_test50.out.correct. (as provided in the spec) in the terminal. However I don't know how the testing work?. I know it's comparing my output to the correct output. It returns with game codes (.       > Hand 0.       > Ivan deals.       > Jack of Diamonds turned up.       > Human player Judea's hand: [0] Nine of Spades.       > Human player Judea's hand: [1] Ten of Spades.       > Human player Judea's hand: [2] Jack of Spades.       > Human player Judea's hand: [3] King of Hearts.       > Human player Judea's hand: [4] Ace of Hearts.       > Human player Judea, please enter a suit, or "pass":.       > Judea passes.       > Human player Kunle's hand: [0] Nine of Clubs.       > Human player Kunle's hand: [1] Ten of Clubs. ...). . Is this my output or the correct output that's being printed?. . Thank you so much!!!
i_answer: This output would be from the correct output. . . For reference on how to interpret sdiff's output, if you type "sdiff filename1 filename2":. . A < is shown if the line appears only in filename1.. . A > is shown if the line appears only in filename2.. . A ! is shown between the lines if they are different..

subject: Play card
content: Queen of Hearts, Jack of Diamonds, Nine of Clubs, King of Spades, . . if trump == hearts and led == diamonds. is the player going to play nine of clubs? if so, why not jack of diamonds?
i_answer: Yep, would play the nine of clubs.As outlined in the spec under Euchre Simple Player Strategy, when playing tricks, the player will always a) try to follow led suit (in this case diamonds). Since the Jack of Diamonds takes on a suit of Hearts (due to it being the left bower with a trump suit of hearts), there are no suits of diamonds to play. The player then goes to strategy b) which is to play the lowest card in their hand, which in this instance is the nine of clubs.

Based on your screenshots, it looks like point() is supposed to update each team's score then point_compute() is supposed to decide what to print, using information such as who ordered up (I believe that's contain_team_1 or 2) and how many tricks that team won. You would have to run through a few test cases with different combinations of number of tricks won by each team and which team ordered up to make sure that you've accurately covered all the cases from the spec, but this seems like it was a reasonable structure overall

subject: Out of bounds error when finding trump suit
content: . . I've tried rewriting the function completely. I used the debugger to find that this error occurs on the second loop I believe on the line of the player.make_trump. Any help is greatly appreciated.
i_answer: There are a couple things to notice here:.  - The vector with the out of bounds error is a vector of Cards, not players. This implies that your issue lies somewhere in this program flow that's accessing Cards, whereas all this shared code is accessing players..  - There are only two rounds while ordering up, and you need to go *all the way around the table* before moving onto the next round.

subject: Player public test
content: When I run Player public test on my IDE, it works fine, but when I submit it do the autograder, I don't get any of the points. Does anyone know the issue or having an issue similar to this?
i_answer: Looks like it is failing because the Autograder doesn't recognize `assert` in your `Player.cpp`. Make sure that you `#include ` at the top of the file.

subject: Autograder Error
content: . Our public tests ran, but why are we getting errors for our player tests.
i_answer: This is a Valgrind error. If you look at the error output, it says "Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialized value(s)", and then you can skim the rest of that block for something that makes sense --> you can see Card.cpp:65, which means line 65 an then you see Card.cpp:222, Player.cpp:72, etc.), so you most likely have some uninitialized value that you're using in one of these lines that's causing an error.. . After that, you can do through the rest of the errors and see if it's the same issue or not!

subject: Add and Discard (Human)
content: In my mind, the only time that the human ever needs to call add and discard is in the event that . 1) they are dealer and trump was made on first round. 2) they are not dealer and made trump themselves on the second round. 3) they are dealer and screw the dealer was invoked.. . does this make sense?
i_answer: To add on onto the student answer on 2 and 3, no one picks up a card in round 2 of making trump

subject: Breaking the Interface?
content: is it breaking the interface if we initialize cards with the form:. . Card c(Card::RANK_TWO, Card::SUIT_DIAMONDS);. . if it is, then how should we go about not breaking the interface when trying to initialize cards for test cases and such?

subject: Left Bower when Making trump
content: Just to check, would a simple player count the left bower of the upcard's suit when determining whether or not to order up?. Ex: The upcard is the King of Spades, a simple player has the Jack of Clubs and the Queen of Spades in their hand, would they order up Spades (count the left bower) or pass (not count the left bower)?
i_answer: They would order up

subject: Autograder vs. VSCode Passing Public Tests
content: Just wondered why there was a discrepancy between autograder and VSCode... Not sure why it is passing on VSCode and not on autograder. Any tips?. .
i_answer: That is pretty odd - it's possible there's some undefined behavior going on due to something like an out-of-bounds access, where it runs ok on your machine but fails on the autograder. I would try running your tests on CAEN to see if you can get it to fail there as well - I would also trying running it through valgrind to see if there is weird memory stuff going on that might cause an issue like this

subject: Error
content: Hello! My euchre.cpp is running fine but only for the first hand. Then I get this error, does anyone know what this means?
i_answer: This is a memory error, you could be trying to assign to a vector/array incorrectly. Have you tried running Valgrind?

subject: Constructor compile error
content: When I try to compile euchre.cpp, I keep getting this error. . Any ideas on why this is happening?.
i_answer: I believe this error occurs if you don't put the members in an initializer list for a constructor in the order they were declared in the class. So if you define a class like:. ```. class Duck {.    int a;.    int b;. }. ```. The `a` member needs to appear in an initializer list before `b`

I understand that this is correct, however every time I enter the arguments it just reprints the exact same sentence. Any idea why this would be happening?.

subject: autograder error
content: . How to interpret this? Does this mean I have errors on line 133, 572, 525 and 148?
i_answer: This means that on those lines, you are using a variable that you have not initialized to make some conditional jump (could be an if statement, for loop, etc.). Make sure those variables are initialized before you use them.

subject: Making trump (just to double check)
content: I just want to double check as I'm trying to find one last bug in player_test.cpp.. When you are in the process of making trump, we do have left bower or right bower, right? As suggested by the suit of upcard?. . For example, when you have:  Jack of Diamonds, Jack of Clubs, Jack of Hearts, Three of Clubs, and Ace of Spades, and the upcard is Jack of Spades, and it is round two, simple player, not dealer, what is going to be the trump suit? Or is it not gonna make trump?. .
i_answer: You should order up and make clubs trump suit

subject: Keep getting segmentation faults
content: I keep on getting segmentation faults and euchre is not printing anything. I tried checking for out of bounds array and vectors and I think I've fixed all of that. But I'm still getting the error. What should I do? At this point, I don't know where I should fix it because I can't debug my code without it printing output.
i_answer: Hm, so if your euchre program isn't printing anything at all before it segfaults, then its likely segfaulting and ending before the first print statement which narrows things down quite a bit. Meaning, you should check your main program up until the first print statement that gets run in your Game class to see where things are going wrong. You can also use the valgrind output from the autograder to help - one error that might be helpful is this one:. ```. ==60== Process terminating with default action of signal 11 (SIGSEGV): dumping core. ==60==  Access not within mapped region at address 0x0. ==60==    at 0x408455: main (euchre.cpp:378). ```. Notice how the error is in your main function, which supports the idea that something in your program is failing early on before it gets to your Game class. I would check specifically on line 378, where you're accessing the `argv` and `ps` arrays.. . Also, I'm not sure if you have your visual debugger set up, but that's always a good option for debugging if your program isn't printing anything, since you can see what it's actually doing before it fails

subject: Autograder no output for euchre.cpp
content: Aloha everyone,. . Maybe I have not looked carefully, but I am running into the problem of not getting output on autograder for my euchre.cpp. Similar to @2104.. . I know I am missing line number 1. I fixed that in my new version. However, I do not get any output after that. In my code, I am printing all the moves, hand, etc doing cout << CODE_HERE << endl; from euchre.cpp.. . Am I not suppose to be printing anything from there?. .
i_answer: From the spec: "Output that is specific to the Human Player should be printed in the appropriate place in the Human Player class. All other output that is common to both Simple and Human Players should be printed by the Euchre simulator itself. The Simple Player should not directly print any output." So some output should be done in the Human Player class, while all other output should be done in euchre.cpp. I can't tell why you're not getting any output without looking at your code, so include your uniqname in your Piazza username so I can see your code on the autograder

subject: Don't know what this error means
content: Hi, I'm not able to understand these errors. . . . I'm just not sure why I'm getting this error. . . Please help!
i_answer: My guess is that you only have return statements within if statements and else-if's. If you do this, the compiler will think that the function might never return. You either need a return statement in an else-branch or outside your branches entirely--you may need to return some dummy value to accomplish this even if the function will never actually get there. This link has a short explanation

subject: Are we allowed to print out over assigned max point total, if the final hand is a +2?
content: Are we allowed to print over assigned point total, if the final hand is a +2?. Ex: Like let's say you were going into a hand with 99 points, and you won the final hand with a +2 (march/euchre), would you print 101 or 100? Is this allowed? I didn't see anything on the spec, but wanted to make sure.
i_answer: You'd print the actual total even if it was over the number of points required to win.

Unfortunately, it doesn't print the whole line, so you should take a look at the .out files themselves - you'll probably find that "Hand 0" is getting printed right after the command line arguments (which I did confirm from your autograder as what's happening, so basically make sure you're printing newlines/endl's where necessary!) . . subject: Where exactly should our cout statements be?
content: In auto grader euchre public tests get full points, but euchre public tests with solutions get no points.. . I have a feeling this is because of my cout statements being placed incorrectly(sometimes they're in euchre and sometimes in a player class). . To make sure, is the correct way to do it this:. All cout and cin statements specific to human should be in human player class. No cout or cin statements in simple player class. Any other cout statements would be the same for human and simple player, and should be in euchre.cpp. . Is this correct?. I'm also not sure if this is the only error I have but it seems the most likely. . Thank you for the help!
i_answer: I took a look at your code, and you have some print statements in Player.cpp that should be in euchre.cpp. For example, when a card is led / played by a player, this is common to both Simple and Human so this should go in euchre.cpp

subject: Dealer and the upcard
content: In what situation is the dealer allowed to take the upcard. The pdf describing the game says that "Unlike in round 1, the dealer will not have the opportunity to take the upcard" but says nothing about the dealer taking the upcard earlier in the pdf
i_answer: In the first round of making trump, the dealer is given the option to take the upcard, and discard one of their own. If the upcard is a really nice card, the dealer would probably want to swap out for it! (I imagine that's how real-worldstrategy works, haha) In short, on round one of taking trump, the dealer is allowed to swap out the upcard for one in their hand if they want to do this. In round 2, this is not an option.

i_answer: Nvm I fixed it! The error was pretty specific to my code but using my address sanitizer and debugger helped a little to figure out what the problem was.

subject: How to use sort() for Pack()
content: Hello,. . I am a little confused as to how to use the sort() function, more specifically how I would try to sort a pack of cards to be sorted by rank, then suit as stated in the Pack() spec. but to my knowledge, the < operator is supposed to sort by rank first, breaking ties with the suit. So how should I make it so that the queen of spades isn't next to the queen of hearts and instead next to the rest of the hearts? Any hints?
i_answer: If I understand your question right, it seems like you want to sort by suit then rank, rather than the other way around as you currently do when calling sort (so get all the Spades together, then Hearts and so on) - there are two ways you could do this:. 1. Write your own sort function to put the same suit together (not super recommended). 2. Write a custom comparator (something that we'll cover a little later in this course). . Both of these aren't great ideas at the current moment, so maybe the first question we should ask is whether we need cards sorted in an order like this - could you explain more about your situation where you need cards grouped together by suit? Hopefully I understood your question correctly!

subject: Why does my shuffle() function work for one test but not another?
content: My shuffle() function has worked for both euchre_test00 and euchre_test50 but for some reason it isn't working for euchre_test01. Why is that?
i_answer: Both euchre_test00 and euchre_test50 specify in the command line input to not shuffle the deck while dealing. Euchre_test01 does, meaning that there is probably something wrong with your shuffle function.

subject: Deep nesting
content: . I know deep nesting could be if-else, but it says in euchre.cpp line 39, my line 39 is this:. . int main(int argc,char * argv[]){. . Does it mean my whole main function is too long?
i_answer: It doesn't mean that your function is too long, rather that you have a nested if/for/while loop that exceeds the maximum of 4. Look to combine some of these statements (ex. If you have if a and then if b, isn't that the same as if a AND b?)

subject: Chosen Card by simple player
content: For the euchre_test00.out.correct, why does Adi play the Nine of Diamonds instead of the Jack of Hearts. Adi does not have cards to follow the lead suit of Spades but the trump suit is hearts so why can't they play the right bower?
i_answer: The student answer is correct, but it's not just the card with the lowest rank--it's the card with the lowest value (i.e. make sure to take into account suit and trump)

i_answer: Make sure that you are correctly deleting your objects after you are done using them.

subject: Euchre game constructor
content: In Euchre.cpp,  I use a game ADT and create a constructor to take in const char * argv[]. . I use these in the initializer list to initialize each part of the command line (such as shuffle choice using argv[2]) using argv. . . Then, when I use the constructor in main, it gives me this error:. can anyone tell me what I'm doing wrong?. .
i_answer: It's possibly an issue with the constness: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18273610/c-char-to-const-char-conversion - its a little confusing thinking about double pointers (which is what argv decays into, being an array of pointers), but the idea is that having only a single const doesn't provide enough protection to prevent modifying the data. So, you could throw in another const there, as shown in the stack overflow example, or you could remove the const altogether (which would work, but from a safety perspective, you probably don't want to allow your Game constructor to modify argv)

subject: Wrong deal one?
content: Hi . . I found that in one of the player's hands, he always has the same card as the upcard. I also printed out the cards in players' hands to find out, notice that Jack of Diamonds turned up but Adi also has this card:. . . . I noticed that the card in Adi's hand is in incorrect sequences, he should have Ten of Diamonds in his hand, rather than Jack of Diamonds. It is weird since other players seemed to have the right cards. I used deal_one() to get the upcard.. I also print out the cards in pack.cpp, which is in the correct rank, so does anybody know where the error could be?
i_answer: What I think is most likely is something to do with add_and_discard. Since Adi is the dealer, and he keeps winding up with the upcard, there may be something in that function. Making sure that the upcard is only added if the dealer chooses to discard a separate one is important, and according to the spec, "If the trump suit is ordered up during round one, the dealer picks up the upcard. ", meaning the dealer should not be adding/discarding if the trump making goes into a second round.

subject: Public tests cpp files pass without failure, but autograder fails

i_answer: I believe the autograder doesn't actually grade your tests to see if they are correct given your code. It checks faulty code with your tests to see how many edge cases it can find. So for example your card test caught 8 out of their 14 bugs.

subject: Weird Error in new.h file
content: I keep getting an error called signal SIGABRT when I try to run a TEST() file, but when I put a random cout << "test"; in the middle of my TEST() file, the error disappears. Also, if I put cout << "t"; instead of cout << "test"; the error returns.. . Edit: It turns out the cout has nothing to do with the error. Sometimes the error is there and sometimes it isn't. I'll run the program and the error will be gone, then I'll click run again and the error will return..
i_answer: That is an odd error - usually when you run your program and you get inconsistent behavior despite not changing anything significant, its the result of some undefined memory access (like indexing out of bounds). I would try running your code through valgrind on CAEN to see if it gives you any hints on errors like that. You could also try running your visual debugger if you have that set up and step through your program a couple times until you get the error - it shouldn't take too long to figure out where the error you're getting is coming from if its happening often enough.

subject: dealer change for every round
content: Hello! Please let me know how the position of dealer changes at the end of each round(five tricks). I think the dealer should be next person the winner of the last trick of each round. But the sample out put give me different answer.. . Fran takes the trick. . Edsger and Gabriel win the hand. euchred!. Edsger and Gabriel have 2 points. Fran and Herb have 0 points. . Hand 1. Fran deals. . Please tell how the index of dealer changes for each round, I cannot find it on the specs. thank you!
i_answer: The dealer begins as player 0, and passes to the left after every hand is finished. In the example with Edsger, Fran, Gabriel and Herb, Ed deals first, followed by Fran, then Gabe, then Herb, and back to Edsger. (I got this from euchre_test01.out.correct from the files we're provided!). . What you might also be thinking of is who leads each trick-- this is decided by whoever won the last trick. There are 5 tricks in a hand, and the first to lead will always be left of the dealer. From then until the end of the hand, whoever wins leads the next hand.. . tldr: the dealer rotates each hand by order of people, but the leader of a trick is decided by the winner, unless it's the first trick in a hand.

subject: accessing order_up_suit
content: I'm writing a making trump function in euchre.cpp (in my Game ADT), and I'm confused how to determine trump in round two of bidding since I can't access order_up_suit from euchre.cpp. In round 1, you can just set trump to upcard.get_suit(), but that doesn't work in round 2 because upcard doesn't matter.
i_answer: order_up_suit is a string passed by reference. This means if the player chooses to make trump, the string you pass into the function will become the trump suit.

subject: euchre_test01 first hand question
content: As attached below, when I run the first hand of euchre test 01, my program dictates that Gabriel should play the Jack of Diamonds because it is of the led suit (King of Diamonds). The correct output states that Gabriel should actually play the Nine of Clubs. I am confused as to why he would play the Nine of Clubs (not of led suit) instead of the Jack of Diamonds (of led suit). I checked to make sure that this card was in his hand, and you can see in the correct output that he plays this card 2 rounds later, so it must be in his hand. Clarification on this would be greatly appreciated.. . . ^^^Correct output screenshot (Line 21 shows him playing the nine of clubs, and line 32 shows that he later played the Jack of Diamonds, so it was in his hand). . . ^^^my output where instead of playing the nine of clubs, he plays the Jack of Diamonds (which does not match the correct output. . . ^^^ the Simple player rules for playing tricks, stating that if a simple player can follow suit, they play the highest card of that suit. . My understanding of this is that Gabriel can follow suit, since the led suit is the King of Diamonds and he has the Jack of Diamonds in his hand, but the correct output appears to disagree with this understanding.. . Any clarification on the rules and/or why I am incorrect about this would be greatly appreciated, thank you.
i_answer: If trump is hearts, then the Jack of diamonds (left bower) would be considered a heart. If there were no other diamond cards in the player’s hand (unable to follow suit), then they would play the lowest card, assuming that’s the nine of clubs.

subject: simple play_card strategy
content: . I have no idea why Gabriel plays Nine of Clubs instead of playing Ten of Clubs when she can follow the lead card.
i_answer: If a simple player cannot follow lead suit, they play the lowest card in their hand. Since Gabriel does not have any spades (Jack of Clubs is a spade because it is the left bower), they play the lowest card, which is Nine of Clubs.

subject: Cout Statements for Simple Players
content: Hi! I am confused about when to count statements for simple player since they are not included in the implementation in player.cpp. In my game ADT, where do I place the cout statements while also allowing the human implementation to cout whenever needed?
i_answer: Nothing couts in Simple player member functions, where Human player member functions do. So, anything that is printed in the Simple player output file was printed in euchre.cpp!. So if you're building the game ADT, your ADT's member functions might be the right place to put in cout statements.

subject: return type for function that checks command line?

i_answer: when a statement fails, the main() function has to return a nonzero value, not the helper function you are trying to implement.

subject: how to test euchre_test50 with its .in file?
content: is there any way to test euchre_test50 (thru the terminal) without having to manually having to input the correct action every time?
i_answer: Yes! You can use input redirection ( using `<` on the command line). . From the [spec](https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#hints-for-system-testing), you would run something like this:. ````bash.  $ ./euchre.exe pack.in noshuffle 3 Ivan Human Judea Human Kunle Human Liskov Human  euchre_test50.out. ````

"Control reaches end of non-void function" means that there is a path within your function where you don't return (within your SimplePlayer::play_card() function. Also, just a note that the code after a return statement will not execute so you should either remove those statements or find a way to run that code before you return.

i_answer: This is output from valgrind (meaning you wouldn't get this output on your machine when running the test normally). What these errors are saying is that you are attempting to read memory you shouldn't read. For example, if I had a vector of size 5, and I attempted to read the 6th element, that would be invalid. For this output, it looks like one of these invalid reads led to a segmentation fault.. . To figure out where to look for an incorrect read, these errors contains a call stack for what functions were called. Taking the last error as an example:. main->testsuite->testcase->make_trump_left_bower->make_trump->(and so on). . This sequence can give you an idea as to where to look. (Focus on the files you were responsible for writing)

subject: Player help (@2241) extension (submitting some of my code)
content: Hi! I started the piazza post @2241, and I'm just extremely confused on how to go about implementing the functions in my Player class and figured it might be easier if I could show my code. As of right now, I've implemented the Player functions independently in the HumanPlayer and SimplePlayer derived classes, which makes the most sense to me because most of the functions have different implementations depending on if the player is a SimplePlayer or a HumanPlayer. But what's getting me super stuck is what to write in the implementations for each function in the Player base class? I've written the following so far:. . . . but I get a compiler error about calling a function within itself. I've tried not having any implementation, and getting rid of the {} brackets entirely, but this results in a compiler error too. I've also attached my player.cpp file so you can find any extra information about my code if needs be. . . Player.cpp. . Please help! I'm super stuck. Thank you
i_answer: You shouldn't be implementing any of the functions in the Player base class because Player is an interface, which basically means it only contains function declarations and not implementations. We do this because it doesn't make sense to have a generic "Player" (players are either Simple or Human), and having this interface allows the two derived classes to share the same functions with their own implementations.

subject: Simple strategy for lead card
content: . I have no idea why Gabriel lead Jack of Spades first, then Jack of Diamonds since Jack of Diamonds should be higher than Jack of Diamonds.
i_answer: From the [spec](https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#leading-tricks) part of the simple player strategy in leading is to play the highest non-trump card in their hand (in this case this would be the Jack of Spades since Jack of Diamonds is considered a trump card given it is the left bower).

subject: Scope of object
content: Hi, I am having what  I believe to be a rather simple scoping issue. In the code chunk I provided, I am unsure of why the count++ inside the for loop/if statement is out of scope for the if(count >= 2) statement. I found that without initializing the initial int count statement and hard coding count++ within the for loop/if statement to equal 2 to pass a test case ( count = 2 instead of count++), the if(count >= 2) statement executes and works. Because of this I am very confused about the grounds of the scope and how to properly access the summed count in the if(count >= 2) statement while initializing the initial count to 0, so count++ is possible.. . . if(round == 1){. int count = 0;. for(int i = 0; i < hand.size(); ++i){. if(hand[i].get_suit() == upcard.get_suit() && hand[i].is_face()){ // take left bower into account. count++;. }. }. if(count >= 2){. order_up_suit = upcard.get_suit();. return true;. }. else{. return false;. }. }.
i_answer: count is declared in the first if statement, so its scoped to the first if statement block. Therefore, you cannot access it. Try moving it out of the if statement to access it in the if(count >= 2)!

subject: Simple play_card
content: The description of Simple play_card is "If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand". . . What if simple doesn't have a card in hand that can follow suit BUT they have trump. Will we still just play the lowest card in simple's hand (when the hand is a mix of trump and cards that can't follow suit)?. . Thank you
i_answer: The player will play the lowest card in their hand.. . Here are a couple scenarios:. . If they have 1 trump and 4 non-trump and none follow suit, they will play the lowest non-trump card.If they have 1 trump and 4 non-trump and a non-trump follows lead suit, they will play the highest lead-suit card.If they have 5 trump and none follow suit, they will play the lowest trump.If they have 5 trump and trump is the lead suit, they will play the highest trump (lead) suit.If they have 4 trump and 1 non-trump and trump is the lead suit, they will play the highest trump (lead) suit.

subject: confusion with over correct output
content: . So I'm a little bit confused as to why this is the correct output. In this scenario Gabriel has two cards left in his hand the Queen of Hearts and the Jack of Diamonds, the the trump suit is Hearts. The expected output in in red on the left and my output is in green on the right.. . According to the spec simple players should play the highest card that follows suit, and if they can't to play the lowest card in their hand. So in line 27 Gabriel couldn't follow suit and should've played his lowest card. So why did he play the Queen of Hearts, which is, both with and without considering trump, higher than the Jack of Diamonds?
i_answer: Hearts is trump in this hand, so the Jack of Diamonds is a trump card (left bower) and higher than the Queen of Hearts.

subject: Testing add_card
content: Making test cases for add_card where it fills in the member variable "hand", which is a vector. Then to check that it is reading iit n correctly, I want to access that member variable of Simple and see if it is equal to what add_card read in. the Problem is it keeps saying "class 'Player' has no member 'hand'." I included <vector> library.. . as = "Ace of Spades". ah = "Ace of Hearts". etc.. . .
i_answer: If you take a look at player, there is no hand member variable (remember that we are working with player pointers, not human or simple player pointers). Hand is something you add in for simple and human player, but the interface of player does not have a hand. Therefore you cannot access it outside the simple and human player classes.

subject: Euchre Test 1 Confusion

i_answer: 10 in the arguments refers to the number of points needed to win, not the total number of hands played.

subject: Error

subject: Player.cpp, Player plays wrong card
content: I and my partner stumbled onto Gabriel playing the wrong card (Jack of diamonds) instead of 9 of clubs in trick 3 of euchre test 01. Here is a segment of our code. Any tips to handle this situation?. . . .
i_answer: When you're trying to find the cards that follow suit of the led card, you use get_suit() (i.e. hand[i].get_suit() == led_card.get_suit() ).  This get_suit doesn't consider trump.  Use the other get_suit function that takes in a trump parameter to determine if the cards in your hand follow the led card's suit.

subject: std::bad_alloc
content: . void Pack::shuffle() {. std::array<Card, PACK_SIZE> shuffle;. std::array<Card, (PACK_SIZE/2)> firstHalf;. std::array<Card, (PACK_SIZE/2)> secondHalf;. . for (int j = 0; j < 7; ++j) {. // shuffle once- helper function. . for (int f = 0; f < PACK_SIZE/2; ++f) {. firstHalf[f] = cards[f];. }. . for (int s = 0; s < PACK_SIZE/2; ++s){. secondHalf[s] = cards[s + (PACK_SIZE/2)];. }. . for (int a = 0; a < PACK_SIZE; a += 2) {. shuffle[a] = firstHalf[a];. shuffle[a + 1] = secondHalf[a];. }. }. cards = shuffle;. . When I run this code on Public pack tests, I get an error due to std::bad_alloc and I have no idea what that means (Internet said something about memory but I didn't get it).
i_answer: That can be due to accessing outside of the bounds of an array. Try running it through the visual debugger to see what line is triggering it.

i_answer: You removed some code in Card.cpp that you shouldn't have. Add this back and you should be good.

subject: How is each deck reshuffled after each hand?
content: After each hand, how is the deck reshuffled? Because if its the same ordered deck being shuffled, every hand would be the same, the only thing that would change would be who won
i_answer: You shuffle the already shuffled deck. It is not like the deck is reset to state zero after each hand.

subject: Shuffling even when noshuffle is argv[2]?
content: For testing purposes, I've added a "we are shuffling!" statement, so I know what's been read. For whatever reason. As seen on the terminal, I'm using a "noshuffle", yet it's saying that argv[2] is "shuffle". Any idea why this is?. . Here's the code for read_shuffle:. . // pretty simple-- if argv2 is shuffle, the deck is shuffled..  void read_shuffle(int argc, char* argv[]) {.   . .   if (strcmp(argv[2], "shuffle")) {.    is_shuffled = true;.    cout << "we are shuffling !" << endl;.   }.   else {.    is_shuffled = false;.   }.  }. And this is called within the Game ctor,(And the rest seems to read in correctly?). . And read_all is:. . // reads everything in..  // see individual functions for explanations..  void read_all(int argc, char* argv[]) {.   read_deck(argc, argv);.   read_players(argc, argv);.   read_shuffle(argc, argv);.   read_points(argc, argv);.  }. . . Any help would be super appreciated-- I know there isn't much time left for the project, and I've had to do 90% of the work.
i_answer: strcmp(argv[2], "shuffle") might not do exactly what you think it does. Check out what it returns. For reference, in an if statement, anything that is not definitively false (or 0 or nullptr) will evaluate to true.

subject: Euchred and march!
content: Could there be a euchre and a march at the same time? Because my output code had both as a result of a certain hand but the correct output only had one of them.
i_answer: A march happens when the winning team also ordered up, whereas a euchre happens when the winning team doesn't order up. They cannot possibly happen simultaneously.

subject: Add and discard making too big of a hand
content: In the public test case for test_simple_player_lead_card it adds 5 cards to the hand and then calls add_and_discard. Our add_and_discard function calls the add_card function before finding what card to remove, but this would require that the hand briefly hold 6 cards, which fails the hand size being less than MAX_HAND_SIZE assert. What do?
i_answer: I think it's fine to temporarily have 6 cards in your hand as long as at the end of add_and_discard() the hand only has 5.

subject: When to reset and reshuffle?
content: in euchre(.cpp), when playing, when does the hand get reset and reshuffled? is it after every trick or after every hand?
i_answer: Every hand, so every time each player has 0 cards in their hand.

subject: Allocating an object of abstract class type 'SimplePlayer'
content: Hi! We are getting this error at the end of our SimplePlayer class where we use:. . ". Player * Player_factory(const std::string &name, const std::string &strategy) {.     if (strategy == "Simple") {.         return new SimplePlayer(name);.     }. " . as described in the spec. We checked to make sure none of our functions have Player:: like we saw in another piazza answer, and we have a constructor defined as well as all of the other functions defined within the class. Any help would be awesome, thank you!
i_answer: Try adding the override keyword to the member functions you are trying to override and recompile.  What's most likely happening is that you accidentally changed the function signature of one of the functions you want to override.  Adding the override keyword will help point out which function signatures don't match

subject: helper functions question
content: Is it possible to use the helper functions we wrote in Player.cpp in Player_tests.cpp?
i_answer: If you declared your helper functions as static (which you should), then you cannot use them outside of the file in which it was declared. Your helper functions should be used to help reduce code duplication / complete a specific task within one file, which is why we make them static. I would recommend writing some helper functions in Player_tests.cpp if you find yourself writing the same code over and over for your tests

subject: Opening pack_in error
content: my pack(&istream) opens fine, but when it tries to pass in the istream via:. . . I get a stack buffer overflow in 'string'.  Why is this?  My condition for reading in this file in the function implementation is: . . pack_input being the reference variable for istream. . . what might cause this error?. . error being:. .
i_answer: The condition you currently have will infinite loop. Instead, use while(pack_input >> x >> ...) to check if there is any more input to retrieve. The while loop will break once there is no more input to read.

subject: Clarification on spec (Simple player playing tricks)
content: . The given definition for play_card is:. . virtual Card play_card(const Card &led_card, const std::string &trump). An example case that I'm a bit unsure on is this:Let's say player A has, in their hand, Jack of Diamonds, Jack of Hearts, Ace of Diamonds, and Nine of Diamonds. The trump is Diamonds, so they lead with Jack of Diamonds. Next, they play.Do they play Ace of Diamonds or Jack of Hearts? They say "the highest card that follows suit"-- if the lead suit and the trump happen to be the same, does the left bower count as the 2nd highest card (in this situation)? If the led suit and the trump aren't the same-- say the trump is Clubs and the led card is 10 of Hearts, they'd play the highest hearts (Ace of Hearts at max) if they can match the suit, right?When run with our code, we get Ace of Diamonds, and with our existing code that is the correct outcome. But I don't know if that's like... correct euchre-wise. edit after some OH: The Jack of Hearts would be played, because it's considered to be the same as a Diamond
i_answer: marking resolved

subject: MAKING SURE ON HIGHEST VALUE
content: Say I have Ace of Spades and Nine of Diamonds ( not considering trump and led suit). . Is it true that Nine of Diamonds > Ace of Spades??. . Thank you!
i_answer: When you determine the value of cards, you consider rank before considering suit. In this case, since ace is higher than nine, without even looking at the suits (since we don’t care about trump), we know the ace of spades is higher.

subject: euchre constructor error
content: In the euchre.cpp I created a class Game with a constructor. Game(string shuffletype, int winPoints, vector<Player>*ps),. and in my main function I intended to create a constructor by writing. Game euchre(shuffletype, winPoints, ps) . (shuffletype in string type, winPoints in int type, and ps is a vector in Player type with players already included). but I keep getting the error "No matching constructor for initialization of 'Game'". I don't know how to fix it, and any help is greatly appreciated!
i_answer: It looks like the constructor you made takes in a pointer to a vector of players (i.e. vector<Player>* ps), when instead you want it to take in a vector of player pointers (i.e. vector<Player*> ps)

subject: Ideas on How to Test Human Player

subject: player initialization
content: when a simple/human player is initialized, is their hand supposed to be empty by default? Because of the card constructor, when I create the simple player member variable, Card hand[5], it automatically fills the player's hand with five Two of Spades. this leads me to failing the test_simple_player_lead_card test in player public tests.
i_answer: The hand should be empty by default when initialized. Functions such as `add_card` will modify the hand as necessary.

subject: tricks vs hands
content: There are 5 tricks per hand, but how many hands are we supposed to simulate in euchre.cpp? I'm guessing we keep going until a team reaches the points needed to win?
i_answer: You play as many hands as it takes to get one team the amount of points needed to win (points needed to win are specified in argc)

subject: make_trump for Simple Player class
content: . I used a for loop to measure how many trump face cards a player has for round 1 and 2. Then I used if statements to see if the player has enough trump face cards to order up. But once it returns true when the when the player has the right number of trump face cards, what happens to the order_up_suit? I'm having trouble determining how this variable should be altered when in this condition. Thank you for your help in advance.
i_answer: You can set the order up suit before you return true.

subject: Code Duplication for Derived Classes
content: Hello,. . I have declared my SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer derived classes inside of player.cpp. These include the functions get name, add card, etc. from the base player functions. Autograder is telling me that my class definitions are duplicates of each other. This is actually true, as they have the same members. Is there some way to prevent this? Methods are implemented outside of the class using the namespace resolution operator (::).. . Thanks,Thomas Kennings
i_answer: You can create your own helper functions inside your Player.cpp. This may help you avoid duplicate code.

subject: Pack::shuffle() splitting an array
content: for shuffle(), I'm confused about how to split the card array into two equal parts. If there are any notes or example functions similar that someone could point me to, that'd be great.
i_answer: You can create two new arrays that are half the size.

subject: segmentation fault address sanitizer
content: I'm testing player_public_test.exe right now and I've used both address sanitizer and cout statements to find out that the main problem is at line 81 on player.public.test.cpp. I'd like to know more about the location of the segmentation fault (basically, I don't know how to decipher this error).
i_answer: Your screenshot and your latest autograder valgrind output definitely point towards add_card being problematic - I believe it's an issue with initializing your handsize member variable on your derived player classes. It's initialized to 5 in both classes, however there aren't 5 valid cards in their hand when a Player is first created. So, when you add_card for the first time, and you use your contains and index helper functions to check if the card exists or not, you're actually looking through uninitialized indices of your hand array.

subject: identifier RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT is undefined
content: I originally posted this error at https://piazza.com/class/ksoz9z684qy18u?cid=2016 but was encouraged to make a private post if I wanted to post my full code. Here's the context of the error. Pack.h is included at the top.. . . .
i_answer: Are you able to compile your program? From your original post, it seems like you have all the necessary includes, so it's possible this is only an IDE configuration issue. I would make sure that you've included/excluded all the appropriate files from the build (if you're not using VSCode), and possibly try restarting your IDE too. . . A good test would also be to compile your program from the terminal using the Makefile to see if that works (for Pack that would be something like `make Pack_public_test.exe`)

subject: rank question
content: In this case where diamond is the trump suit why does Herb play nine of spades instead of nine of clubs. Aren't they both equally ranked?
i_answer: When you determine the value of cards, you consider rank, then suit to break a tie. Suits are ranked with clubs higher than spades, so the nine of clubs is considered to be of higher value than the nine of spades.

subject: deal_one and reset
content: For the deal_one() function, the RME says it returns the next card in the pack and increments the next index. The p3 walkthrough slides says we need to pop the card that the next index points to. I'm confused as to whether that violates the RME considering there's no mention of removing the card after it's been dealt but it makes sense since empty() wouldn't work otherwise. I'm also confused as to how next will have a value if none of RMEs off the pack functions include something about initializing the next private variable. If we can "pop" the dealt card, I'm not sure how to go about that since cards is an array and not a vector. Also for reset, it says to reset the next index to the first card, is that pretty much just setting the space in the next index of cards to the first card? Reset makes it sound like it has to reset the cards array to what it was originally before any card was dealt.
i_answer: You shouldn't remove any cards from the pack, only return the card at the next index and then increment next. Also, you should initialize the next variable in your Pack constructor. Sorry that this wasn't made clear in the walkthrough slides or spec.

subject: "Euchered" Scoring Question
content: "If the winning team did not order up, they receive 2 points for taking 3, 4 or 5 tricks, which is called euchred."  This is the condition for "euchered",  though I'm curious if this is saying that the team that won via "euchered" did not order up at all, or just ordered up for fewer tricks than the other team did.. . Thanks
i_answer: Ordering up only happens once per round (5 tricks). So, "euchred" is for the team that did not order up at the start of the round, if they then went on to win 3, 4, or 5 tricks.

subject: Add and discard
content: For round one, if the upcard suit is ordered up and the dealer takes in the upcard into their hand and discards one card. That one discarded card can potentially also be the upcard that they discard? If that is the lowest card compared to the rest of their hand?
i_answer: Yes, the player adds the upcard to their hand, then removes the lowest value card from their hand. This can still be the upcard that they first added.

subject: Why is this the output for euchre test 01?
content: . In the correct output for euchre test 01, why does Gabriel play the Nine of Clubs when he has a Jack of Diamonds in his hand and the suit led is diamonds?  Aren't simple players supposed to play the card of whatever suit was led if they have it?
i_answer: I think that it is because Fran turned up Hearts, so the Jack of Diamonds is the left bower. Because of this, Jack of Diamonds is actually a Heart. Due to the simple player strategy, Gabriel would then play the lowest card that he has (9 of clubs) because he doesn't have a Diamond.

subject: Long function
content: . . Could any of the instructors see my latest autograder submission and tell me how I can make the main function under 40? I don't know what exactly "Method of 50" means. In a previous post, someone said it is referring to source code, but I don't exactly know that is either. Could you tell me all the instances of source code?  Am I using too many functions? Do you have any suggestions?
i_answer: This just means that your line cant be more than 50 characters, to solve this break your line apart into multiple lines thus turning one long line into a smaller less than 50 character lines.. For example:. if(x == 5 & a == 5 & b == 5 & c == 5 & d == 5){. return true;. }. could be . if(x == 5 &.     a == 5 &.     b == 5 &.     c == 5 &.     d == 5){. return true;. }

Looks like you're changing the function signature of get_name() and make_trump().  Both of those member functions in Player.h are const functions, i.e. there is a const keyword after the parameter list.  Make sure you have added the const keyword when overriding those functions in your derived class implementations in Player.cpp

subject: Simple Player Play Trick: lowest card question
content: Let's say the player does NOT have any lead cards.. . According to the spec: If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand. . Is trump supposed to be taken account into finding the lowest card?. Say there exists a trump card one lower in rank than a non-lead, non-trump card... would this lower ranked card be played OR is it counted as trump and therefore not the lowest and the other non-lead, non-trump is played?
i_answer: Trump should be considered when finding the lowest card.

i_answer: Check out the differences between C++ Arrays (first example) and C-style arrays (second example).

i_answer: When trying to index in a "circular" way (for example, if we start at 1 and have a 4 element vector: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 0) check out the % operator.

subject: Segmentation fault in euchre not sure how to resolve
