i_answer: I recommend utilizing your debugger -- it should stop automatically on the line that causes a segmentation fault.. . Valgrind may also be of use, but your debugger should be your #1 tool for solving problems like this.

subject: euchre.cpp comments
content: Do we have to design and write out comments/RMEs (kind of like an interface) in our euchre.cpp file for our functions and Game ADT?
i_answer: It's not required, and isn't worth any points on the Autograder.

subject: Autograder doesn't give me output
content: Hi. in terminal, I get the right output like this:. . but in the autograder, it gives me error like this:. . I checked line 83, I want to cout the name of player[d], I initialized d, and player is a vector whose size is 4. How can I fix this error?
i_answer: Valgrind does not know our RMEs and therefore will report error as if it was evaluating your code at face value. Check where you are calling player_factory(), valgrind sees the conditional around that spot as not-needing to be satisfied, and therefore is giving you a warning that players[0] could be uninitialized (or initialized to a nullptr).. . Do you need to wrap your player factory in that conditional check?

subject: project 3 cards that have already been played
content: Are we supposed to delete cards from a player's hand after they have used it in a trick? Or are we supposed to leave the hand exactly the same throughout the round and print every card each time (regarding human player) and assume players remember which cards they have already played and are therefore unable to play again?
i_answer: You should remove cards from a player's hand after they have been used.

subject: Left bower and playing card
content: For the Simple player, if the trump suit is spades and the leading card is Ten of Clubs, then is it possible for the simple player to play Jack of clubs if it has Jack of clubs and Ten of Hearts?. . I think Jack of clubs is a left bower, so it is considered spades, which means it should play Ten of Hearts(which is the lowest card in the hand).
i_answer: You are correct. You should play ten of hearts

subject: Autograder not outputting anything?
content: The autograder is not showing output from our failed oclint tests, and is instead showing an error saying:. . and then in the output box just showing:. . Not sure if this is a bug on our end or the autograder, but has happened with all of our submissions so far.
i_answer: Per @2006 this is probably not your fault! We will update that question and/or make an announcement when we figure out what's up!

subject: Functions in Human Player
content: we want to add a print hand function to the Human player class only (since simple player never prints out their hand). Can we add this function directly to the human player class? or can we not add new function stubs to the human player class since there is no equivalent in player.h?
i_answer: You are allowed to add any helper functions to the classes if you want.

subject: Euchre Rules Question
content: If a player has the cards JH, 10H, and QH, and they are leading with the trump suit being Hearts, would they play the Jack of Hearts or the Queen of Hearts? Does the Jack of Hearts count as suit diamond?
i_answer: The Jack of hearts would still be a heart if hearts are trump. However the Jack of diamonds would “become” a heart. So I’m this case the player would lead with the Jack of hearts.

subject: Human Player make_trump
content: I don't understand why we are giving the human player the option to choose any suit as the trump suit (in round 1). I thought a player would have to order up or pass on choosing the upcard's suit as trump suit, but it seems like the human player completely disregards the upcard and chooses their own suit. Am I missing something?
i_answer: You make the assumption that the human player will follow the rules which in this case means they’ll enter the upcard suit.

subject: Should we use the sort function in SimplePlayer?
content: For, add and discard, lead card and play card. All the functions require us to do something with the minimum value and the maximum value card in the function. Should this take trump into account. . . For add_and_discard(), trump would be irrelevant, however, shouuld we be factoring trump into consideration for lead_card and play_card. Because technically let's say I had a hand : [9 of Spades, 10 of Hearts, King of Clubs, King of Hearts and Ace of Clubs] with Spades as trump. In this case after sorting, the lowest value would be 9 of spades. However, the 9. of spades in this case is a trump card so we proceed to the next card which would be the 10 of hearts. Would this be the card we should discard? Or does the simpleplayer just act dumb and never take trump into consideration when looking at the value of the cards?.
i_answer: First of all, for `add_and_discard`, trump is very relevant - the upcard's suit is trump. In `lead_card` you should be taking trump into account and for `play_card` you should be taking the led card and trump suit into account. I implemented `SimplePlayer` without ever sorting the hand, so I don't think you need to sort it.

subject: euchre_test 00
content: Is there any way someone could look at my autograder submission and explain my Valgrind error on euchre_test 00. I am just very very confused. . my uniquename is ellenpar
i_answer: It looks like the error comes from line 248 in `Euchre.cpp`, where you call `game.play_trick(trump_suit)`. The issue is that you initialize `trump_suit` to be a string but never set it to anything. I'm assuming you just forgot to set `trump_suit` to be an actual string.

subject: Card sorting error
content: We tried to sort cards in hand using bubble sort. Part of our functions are:. . temp = hand [j];. hand [j] = hand [j+1];. hand [j+1] = temp;. . where temp is Card type.. However, hand[j] didn't change after "hand [j] = hand [j+1];" being executed. Does this has something to do with vector? Or what is the possible reason for this? Thank you!.
i_answer: You're allowed to use the `` library from the C++ standard library so you can use their sort function.

subject: proect 3 sort function
content: In the spec for project 3, we are given the sort function in the description of how to print a human player's hand in ascending order. I was wondering how the sort function orders the cards. What criteria does it use to sort them? Is it essentially only grouping them by rank or by suit?
i_answer: It's using your implementation of `operator

subject: Why does Fran discard the upcard in Hand 0 of test01
content: In hand0 of test.01.out.correct Fran orders hearts by picking up the Nine of Hearts. They then discard the Nine of Hearts and they keep the Nine of Spades. Wouldn't Fran keep the Nine of Hearts and discard the Nine of Spades? How is the Nine of Spades less than the Nine of Hearts?. . UMID: lebj
i_answer: Nevermind, I just realized that the dealer adds_and_discards, not the person who makes trump. . Solved!

subject: Simple strategy for play_card
content: When a Simple player plays a card, if they cannot follow the led suit, then "they play the lowest card in their hand.". . At here, when they play the lowest card, is this order considered the trump or not?. . So is the trump card > non-trump card? . Also, if I only have trump cards, then does Ace is lower than Jack(which is a right bower)?
i_answer: It does consider the trump suit. An Ace of the trump suit is lower than both the left and right bowers.

subject: One wrong card in the last turn of some hands
content: I don't know if any one has been faced with similar problems but when I'm running test01, in some hands there will be one and only one wrong card appearing in the last turn. Does anyone knows how to solve this? Many thanks!.
i_answer: Well I'm not sure which side is which, but on the left side Fran leads with the ace of spades twice in a row, and this can't happen because they should only be able to play that card once. Make sure than when you lead/play a card you remove it from the hand.

i_answer: I don't think that's allowed. Make a copy of the hand and sort the copy instead

subject: Compiler Error Using player_factory
content: I'm getting a compiler error when trying to add a new player to the vector of players in Game using player_factory. I've attached a screenshot below. I made sure both the strings passed in were const and had the & in front. .
i_answer: It looks like your players vector is a vector of Player objects.  However, this won't compile since Player is a abstract class (i.e. all of Player's member variables are pure virtual) so we can't create any Player objects.  So to get around the compile error and take advantage of polymorphism, make players a vector of Player pointers.

subject: Trying to do "make euchre.exe" and getting errors like this. Any idea what it means?
content: Any ideas what these errors mean or what we might be able to do to fix them? My partner and I are completely lost.. .
i_answer: It looks like you're trying to allocate space for a Player either in a variable or in memory. You can't do this because Player is an abstract class, so you need to create a `HumanPlayer` or `SimplePlayer` first, get a pointer to one of those and upcast it to a `Player*` pointer.

subject: Adding override explicitly to member declarations
content: Do we need to add the override keyword to our Player member functions? I didn't include it explicitly, and received no points off in AG. I am under the impression that since the Player is a virtual class (or interface) the override is implicit because the name and type signatures are the same. Is there some sort of hidden test where AG checks this?
i_answer: The override is not required for your program to compile, however it is suggested that you use it because if you accidentally get the function signature wrong, then the use of the override keyword will cause your program to not compile which will alert you of your mistake.

I like the idea of having a Pack member variable in your Game ADT, but think of how you can initialize your Pack member variable using an initializer list in a Game constructor and what you would need as arguments for this Game constructor

subject: Simple player logic in test01.out.correct
content: On lines 19-23 in euchre_test01.out.correct, it says. . . King of Diamonds led by Edsger. Nine of Spades played by Fran. Nine of Clubs played by Gabriel. Queen of Diamonds played by Herb. Edsger takes the trick. . Why does Gabriel play the Nine of clubs, when they have a Jack of diamonds which follows suit from the led card. Is this not the instructions for a simple player?. . Gabriel at this point in the game has Nine of Clubs, Queen of Hearts and Jack of Diamonds. The trump suit is hearts.
i_answer: Trump suit is hearts which means that the Jack of Diamonds is considered a heart. Therefore, Gabriel does not have a diamond in his hand, so instead he plays the nine of clubs which would be the lowest card in their hand

subject: Deep nesting
content: Does the Deep Nesting in the style check list consider for loops as well? Or does it only consider nested if?
i_answer: It considers for loops as well as ifs

subject: Shuffling
content: Are we supposed to shuffle after every hand? if yes, do we do that even if the shuffle rule was "noshuffle"?
i_answer: You should shuffle before dealing every time if the shuffle option is enabled. If the shuffle option is not enabled, you should not shuffle in the game.

subject: Error reading in pack.in from command line
content: Hello! I am using my debugger on euchre.cpp, and when I step over this line in my Game constructor:. . . string inName = argv[1];. . . I get the following error: . . . This seems like a valid way to read in the "pack.in" from the command line as a string. When I print out argv[1], I get "pack.in" so I'm not sure what could be wrong with it. Any advice would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
i_answer: Looking at your AG submission, one thing to keep in mind is to not access arguments that you don’t know exist (that is, make sure you are checking the argument count before accessing a potentially out-of-bounds argv array). In your debugger, I recommend clicking through the call stack in the bottom left to make sure you know exactly which line is causing the issue, and then poking around in the local variables in the top left and seeing if anything looks suspicious.. . It’s a bit tough to resolve this type of debugging issue over piazza, so I do recommend coming to office hours if any of the above doesn’t work.. . Edit: . Check out out line 172/173. What happens if leadPlayer == the final element in your array..

subject: greater than operator
content: Hello! I've been having this problem in my test case for the >= operator in card and I'm not sure why? Because technically if the cards are of the same suit, as seen in my test case, then the one of rank 5 (lhs) should be higher than the one of rank 4 (rhs), right? On the left is my implementation of the function
i_answer: get_rank and get_suit return strings so you are attempting to compare strings. This may be an issue in the case you mentioned above. Both start with letters f, and the next letter compared is i and o. o comes after i and therefore has a "higher" value.You may find writing helper functions to get the index of the rank and suit from the arrays we provide you more helpful and compare the indexes instead.

subject: Euchre_test00
content: For this test case why would Dabbala play the Queen of Clubs before the nine of hearts if the led suit is Diamonds? I thought that the value was decided by rank and then suit comes into play if there is a tie.
i_answer: Led suit is diamonds, trump suit is hearts. . . Dabbala doesn't have any diamonds so he plays the lowest value card in his hand. In this case it is the queen of clubs because the hearts card are trump.

i_answer: Player_public_test.cpp is a test file we provide for the AG to run your code against for one of the public test cases.  You also have access to what the test file contains from the starter files.  If your code doesn't compile, then you won't receive any feedback on how it ran or any valgrind errors it has.  The error message "bash: ./Player_public_test.exe: No such file or directory" means that we couldn't compile your code and your test case into an executable to be run

subject: confusing errors and pack constructor
content: I'm trying to use my debugger but I'm getting a bunch of errors in Card.cpp that don't make sense to me. I'm also finding that Pack.cpp throws me an error when I try to use the rank and suit arrays, even though I successfully used them in Card.cpp. I included Card.h at the top of both files. I've been stuck here for a while and would love some insight so I could move forward!. . . .
i_answer: From the Autograder it looks like this issue is solved, but you need to make sure to return something in your get_suit function where the trump is passed in. Sometimes even if you have if statements, the compiler isn't smart enough to know that it will definitely return something (i.e. definitely go into one of these statements), so it says you aren't returning anything in a non-void function. I would try returning something at the end (if you're 100% positive all cases will go into your if statements) and see if that fixes it.

subject: Using sort() in my Human class
content: When I am using sort I am getting this error. I have not seen anyone else get this error and am wondering what the problem is..
i_answer: C-style arrays don't have member functions, so they don't have `.begin()`. Use `std::array` instead.

subject: Document "ostream" could not be saved error
content: Did anyone else get this error? How do I fix it? It pops up when I pull my partner's changes for euchre.cpp.
i_answer: Try restarting Xcode (save first) and your computer. Sometimes when you click the "fix" button on some errors, it will try to make modifications to c++ libraries, which it doesn't have permission to edit.

subject: out of bounds for type 'Card [24]'
content: I'm trying to run Pack_public_test.exe by using the make command then typing ./Pack_public_test.exe in the terminal on CAEN. I am getting errors but in my IDE everything runs as expected with no errors, so I'm not really sure why on CAEN I apparently have some sort of out of bounds problem. Does anyone know what the error message is talking about? This is the output:. . . (text version of the image). . [dannyzzz@caen-vnc-mi08 p3-euchre-copy]$ ./Pack_public_test.exe. Running test: test_pack_default_ctor. /usr/um/gcc-7.1.0/include/c++/7.1.0/array:56:36: runtime error: index 18446744073352094992 out of bounds for type 'Card [24]'. /usr/um/gcc-7.1.0/include/c++/7.1.0/array:56:36: runtime error: index 18446744073352094992 out of bounds for type 'Card [24]'. ASAN:DEADLYSIGNAL. =================================================================. ==3845524==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address 0x7ff9aad28c70 (pc 0x7febea35d54b bp 0x7ffefe694640 sp 0x7ffefe694608 T0). ==3845524==The signal is caused by a READ memory access..     #0 0x7febea35d54a in std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::_M_local_data() /var/tmp/gcc/build/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/libstdc++-v3/include/bits/basic_string.h:166.     #1 0x7febea35d54a in std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::basic_string(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&) /var/tmp/gcc/build/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/libstdc++-v3/include/bits/basic_string.h:423.     #2 0x40d442 in Card::Card(Card const&) /home/dannyzzz/p3-euchre-copy/Card.h:17.     #3 0x40afac in Pack::deal_one() /home/dannyzzz/p3-euchre-copy/Pack.cpp:53.     #4 0x412f53 in test_pack_default_ctor /home/dannyzzz/p3-euchre-copy/Pack_public_test.cpp:18.     #5 0x40d8e9 in TestCase::run(bool) /home/dannyzzz/p3-euchre-copy/unit_test_framework.h:420.     #6 0x40f7a3 in TestSuite::run_tests(int, char**) /home/dannyzzz/p3-euchre-copy/unit_test_framework.h:509.     #7 0x414ad0 in main /home/dannyzzz/p3-euchre-copy/Pack_public_test.cpp:56.     #8 0x7febe8be5492 in __libc_start_main (/lib64/libc.so.6+0x23492).     #9 0x40388d in _start (/afs/umich.edu/user/d/a/dannyzzz/p3-euchre-copy/Pack_public_test.exe+0x40388d). . AddressSanitizer can not provide additional info.. SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: SEGV /var/tmp/gcc/build/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/libstdc++-v3/include/bits/basic_string.h:166 in std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::_M_local_data(). ==3845524==ABORTING
i_answer: It seems to be referencing an array of cards that is out of bounds. If a Pack can only have 24 cards, and therefore 0-23 numbered indexes, an index of 24 would be out of bounds and throw an error. Check pack.cpp @ line 53, and pack public test.cpp @ line 18 to see where you went wrong (where a card array was called with an index of 24)

subject: Confused about how to get name of a player
content: In Player.cpp operator <<, we need to print the name of a player p. However, the class Player does not have a variable "name". And it seems that we cannot modify Player.h to add that variable. I am confused about how to get name of a player, not a SimlplePlayer or HumanPlayer (I could add name when I declare those classes).. . . std::ostream & operator<<(std::ostream &os, const Player &p).
i_answer: The given Player class is completely abstract so the operator doesn't necessarily have to work for the base class. You can't modify the .h file but you can change your own derived classes.

subject: Long function
content: . . . What does the number next to "Method of" indicate? I made every function under 40 lines, but I still get this error. . .
i_answer: NCSS stands for "non-commenting source statements", so "Method of 46 non-commenting source statements exceeds limit of 40" means that you have a function that has 46 source code statements. The oclint flag "-rc=NCSS_METHOD=40" means that you're not allowed to exceed 40.

subject: Error, static assertion failed
content: I'm running into this error when I try to run euchre.cpp. I'm not sure if it has to do with the included files or it seems to have something to do with using a vector. What does it mean? What should I do to fix it?. .
i_answer: Looks like you're trying to create a vector of Player objects.  Since Player is an abstract class (i.e. every member function of Player is pure virtual), we cannot create Player objects.  Try creating a vector of Player pointers instead.

The one that I used to get who took the trick was left without a value initialized to it so it caused this problem to me. subject: Making trump round 1
content: For the simple player, in the make_trump function, there is no argument which is a player pointer, but the spec says we need to know what cards the player has, like trump face cards, thus to judge whether they would order up. But if we put the judging part in main(), the code would be messy since we have to use if else. So we will use is_face(), etc. functions in main and call make_trump? . . If so, what is the point of the return value, bool of make_trump function?
i_answer: The make_trump function is a class function for the player class. When you use it on a player pointer, the compiler sort of adds the player argument in for you behind the scene. . . The return value simply indicates whether the player ordered up or not. True for ordered up a suit, false for passed

subject: Simple playing tricks question
content: Hey all, so I saw on the project spec it says "If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand.". . Does that mean that if, for example, the led card is an Ace of Spades. Disregarding the trump suit, if the simple player had a Jack of Spades and a 10 of spades, it would still return the Jack of spades, even if they would not even win with that card and it would be more logical to discard the 10?. Need to know for the Player_tests test cases. Thanks
i_answer: Yes. Simple player is very rudimentary and will only follow those 2 rules

These are the cards in the hand: Jack of Spades(right bower), Jack of Clubs(left bower), Ten of Spades, Nine of Hearts, Ten of Clubs, and Ace of Hearts.. . My understanding is that the player would play the cards in that order. Jack of Spades, Jack of Clubs, and then Ten of Spades because they are of the leading suit. And then play the lowest card each play: Nine of Hearts, then Ten of Clubs, then Ace of Hearts.
i_answer: As far as I can tell the problem is that you have six cards in the hand, everything else looks good to me.

subject: Card.cpp/ Card.h Erroring
content: Card.cpp. Card.h. . I am having an error establishing my operator functions. I have tried to establish them two different ways, and both lead to compiler errors. these same functions are also underlined red in the header file. I have attached both the files above. . . This is an example from the cpp: . . . bool operator<=(const Card::Card &lhs, const Card::Card &rhs){.   if(operator<(lhs,rhs) || operator==(lhs,rhs)){return true;}.   else{return false;}. }. . I get an error message saying : . . Card.cpp:165:23: error: ‘Card’ does not name a type  165 | bool operator==(const Card &lhs, const Card &rhs){      |                       ^~~~Card.cpp:165:40: error: ‘Card’ does not name a type  165 | bool operator==(const Card &lhs, const Card &rhs){      |                                        ^~~~Card.cpp:165:6: error: ‘bool operator==(const int&, const int&)’ must have an argument of class or enumerated type  165 | bool operator==(const Card &lhs, const Card &rhs){      |      ^~~~~~~~.
i_answer: When we overload operators, the syntax is somewhat unique in which to overload the "<=" operator, the function name is "operator<=". . However, we don't need that same syntax when we actually use the operator, we can just use "<=". . To give an example with respect to your code, instead of if(operator<(lhs,rhs))  you can do if(lhs<rhs)

subject: lead_card and play_card functions
content: My partner and I had a question about lead_card and play_card functions in Player.cpp. Should we be printing out "[rank] of [suit] led by/played by [player name]" at the end of those functions? We did it that way and the player public test passed, but we wanted to confirm.
i_answer: The spec says that "all other output that is common to both Simple and Human Players should be printed by the Euchre simulator itself." Since both Simple and Human Players will be printing out "led by/play by," those statements should be saved for euchre.cpp.

subject: Sort function
content: When comparing cards using sort, how does the sort function consider the suits?
i_answer: Sort uses your overloaded operators to compare cards when sorting, thus it will consider suits the same way your < function does.

subject: Failing euchre public test but fine with euchre public solutions
content: I am failing the euchre public test cases, but I am passing public test with solutions. What does this mean? . Also, how could I fail the public test with solutions for test01 and pass test 00? Isn't both of them implementing the same player but with different goal score? . Any help is appreciated. Thank you.. . . .
i_answer: The public test with solution card, player, pack tests your euchre.cpp with a correct implementation of card, player and pack.. The regular public test tests your euchre.cpp with your card, player, and pack. . . This indicates that your euchre file, when using the correct card, player, and pack, performs correctly for 00 and 50. But, your euchre file does not perform correctly with your card, player, and pack.. . As for the difference between 00 and 01, they have a different points goal and different shuffle requirements.

subject: euchre command line

i_answer: 3 is the number of the points required to win the game. You can use any number between 1 and 100 inclusive.

subject: Make_Trump Round 2
content: If a player has 2 face cards of different suits, both are of the appropriate color, which one will the simple player pick? For example, the upcard was a 10 of hearts. The simple player has a Queen of Hearts and a King of Diamonds, and 3 non face cards. Which trump suit should they pick? . . In the same scenario, but the hand is a queen of hearts, a king of diamonds, and an ace of diamonds, which suit will the simple player pick?
i_answer: If the upcard was a 10 of hearts and the player passed during round one, after round one is done hearts can no longer be ordered up, so the simple player would choose diamonds.

subject: Print hand Helper function
content: Currently trying to implement a helper function to print the hands of simple player alice and human player bob in my player tests, the code is as follows:. . (it's the same idea for the human player);. . but when I try to call print hand, I get this error:. . . the only file I include in my test cases is "player.h" (though I tried also including player.cpp but that neither made sense nor helped). . What am I doing wrong here?. . thanks
i_answer: print_hand is part of the Simple/Human player class which means you can only call within the class. The only functions you can call outside the class is the functions from the Player interface as we create Player pointers (print hand is not part of the player class), not simple/human player pointers.

subject: questions about euchre.cpp
content: As I keep coding, I'm running into things that confuse me, so this might be a little lengthy. Apologies!Originally, I was having this error: But I think the issue was that I didn't make a game ctor, and now it seems pretty happy in this form: When I tried to make the file, I got these errors:. . . First was an easy fix, I removed the Game:: that I had put into the ctor. The other two come from the functions read_shuffle and arg_errors. Both are called within the Game ctor-- arg_errors is called instantly to assure that the input is nice and valid, and read_shuffle is part of read_all, which reads/parses argc[]. Here is the code to the functions in question:. . PUBLIC:. . . Game(int argc, char* argv[]) {.   arg_errors(argc, argv);.   read_all(argc, argv);.  }. . . . . void read_all(int argc, char* argv[]) {.   read_deck(argc, argv);.   read_players(argc, argv);.   read_shuffle(argc, argv);.   shuffle();.   read_points(argc, argv);.  }. PRIVATE:. . void read_shuffle(int argc, char* argv[]) {.   if (argv[2] == "shuffle") {.    is_shuffled = true;.   }.   else {.    is_shuffled = false;.   }.  }. (note: is_shuffled is a private bool). . . bool arg_errors(int argc, char* argv[]) {. .   string error_statement = "Usage: euchre.exe PACK_FILENAME [shuffle|noshuffle] ".    "POINTS_TO_WIN NAME1 TYPE1 NAME2 TYPE2 NAME3 TYPE3 ".    "NAME4 TYPE4";. . .   // "There are exactly 12 arguments, including the executable name itself.".   if (argc != 12) {.    cout << error_statement << endl;.    return true;.   }. .   // "Points to win the game is between 1 and 100, inclusive.".   if (atoi(argv[3]) < 1 || atoi(argv[3]) > 100) {.    cout << error_statement << endl;.    return true;.   }. .   // "The shuffle argument is either shuffle or noshuffle.".   if (!(argv[2] == "shuffle") || argv[2] == "noshuffle") { // notice the !.    cout << error_statement << endl;.    return true;.   }. .   // "The types of each of the players are either Simple or Human.".   // after counting, the player type argv's are 5, 7, 9, 11.   for (int i = 5; i < 12; i += 2) {.    if (!(argv[i] == "Simple" || argv[i] == "Human")) {.     cout << error_statement << endl;.     return true;.    }.   }. .   return false;.  }. I'm unsure what to change within these functions to get rid of these errors-- alternatively, if there are any glaring issues you see with my code, I'd love to know. Thank you so much!
i_answer: It's complaining because you're comparing c strings to string literals (which are also c strings). You can only use == if one of the things you're comparing is a C++ string. I'd recommend storing one of the things you compare in a C++ string before doing the comparison.

subject: What are source statements?
content: The Autograder long functions style check talks about source statements in functions. Do brackets count as source statements?
i_answer: You can read here about how oclint (which is what the autograder style checker runs) determines non-commenting source statements: https://oclint-docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/rules/size.html#highncssmethod. They have a nice example there, but basically no, brackets don't count when determining the length of a function.

subject: Play_card special scenario
content: If the led suit AND trump suit are Diamonds, and someone had Ace of diamonds and Jack of hearts in his hand, which card would he play as a simple player? (Jack of hearts is the left bower so would it be considered as the same suit as the led card?)
i_answer: It should be the Jack of Hearts because that's the highest valued card in the person's hand.. . The led suit and trump suit are the same suit (Diamonds), so when playing a card from the led suit in this context, we are basically playing a card from the trump suit. The trump suit in this case consists of Jack of Diamonds (right bower), Jack of Hearts (left bower), Ace of Diamonds, King of Diamonds, Queen of Diamonds, Ten of Diamonds, and Nine of Diamonds based on the cards that have a higher value. We pick the highest valued card to play, which is the Jack of Hearts.

subject: screw the dealer
content: Hello,. . In the screw the dealer case, what will happen if the dealer has no card of the same color as the upcard?. . Thank you!
i_answer: I believe you're talking about Simple Players - in the screw the dealer case, their strategy doesn't really consider any cards in their hand - "the dealer will always order up the suit with the same color as the upcard". So even if they don't have any cards of that suit and it wouldn't be a good choice, they'll still order up the same color suit as the upcard

subject: Super Confusing Style Errors From Caen
content: I'm really confused by the errors I'm seeing in CAEN and I'm wondering how to fix it. I attached the error from CAEN as well as the code that has the error.. . . .
i_answer: The first error is telling you that you have too many lines/statements (excluding blank lines/brace lines/comments) in this play_card function. I would see if you can condense it, combine lines, or create a helper function to fix this!For the second and third errors, this is based on deepness. As an example:for (…) {   for (…) {     if (…) {          …     }   }}This has nesting of 3 (assuming it’s not in a function). You start at the function header and count the number of indents to the innermost line. This would be the outer for loop —> inner for loop —> inner for loop if statement —> the … inside the if statementThere are three arrows, so it’s a deep nested loops of three. I would recommend thinking about if you can combine some statements or use a helper function!

subject: Game ADT Questions
content: I have some overall confusion about creating the Game ADT. If I understand correctly all the function stubs (and the implementation if you choose) go within the Game ADT under public. Under private there are certain objects there as well. Is there a good way to think about what is public versus private? . . Also on Player can we create more public (or private?) variables that can be then changed in the GAME ADT? For example (unrelated to the project) if we wanted each player to be known if they are eating during each round we could create within Player bool eating; and then access that through GAME ADT each round and change it to true or false depending on the circumstances. Or is this not allowed?
i_answer: Members should be public if it makes sense for them to be accessed from outside the Game ADT. For example if you had a member function called play_hand, you'd probably want that to be public so that you could call it outside the Game class. However, you probably want the array of players within the game class to be private, since only the game should have access to those players.. . You are not allowed to modify the definition of Player in the header file, and you also should not explicitly access members of SimplePlayer or HumanPlayer. To use your example, rather than storing whether or not the player is eating within the player itself, the Game could have a separate list of player names or indices to keep track of which players are eating. The Game ADT should hold all the information you need in one place, and you shouldn't have to make any changes to the API of Pack, Card, or Player.

subject: Player array and Pack constructor in euchre.cpp
content: I am posting as only viewable to instructors and I, since I'm including code in the post. I am trying to make an array of players, but I get an error saying that it is an abstract type. Since there can be a mix of Simple and Human players in a game, though, how else can an array of players be created?. . I am also trying to make a pack with the Pack constructor which takes in an istream. Why am I getting this error? Here is my Pack constructor.. . I also found in the spec: "Before you begin, think about which helper functions you would like to add and what they should do. For example, functions that shuffle, deal and make trump are a good starting point." Weren't the shuffle and make functions already implemented in previous files, though?. . Thank you!.
i_answer: Player is an abstract class (notice how we set virtual function = 0 in Player.h) so we can't actually have an object of Player type. How could we then make an array of objects that could refer to either a Human or Simple Player? To answer this I would check out the Lab 5 slides/Lecture slides on Polymorphism. Remember that we can still declare pointers that point to players, and these pointers can have different static and dynamic types.. . In terms of the spec, it's moreso indicating that different player types have different strategies, and so their methods of playing, dealing, and making will be different depending on the implementation, and so it might be useful to create member functions for each player type that execute certain aspects of the different strategies..

subject: Simple Player Playing Card
content: I just have a quick question: For the simple player it is described as if they can follow suit play the largest suit. Otherwise play smallest in hand. Does follow suit mean the led suit or the trump suit? . . For example:. . Trump Suit: Spades. Lead Suit: Diamonds. . Simple Hand:. Ace of Spades. Nine of Hearts. Queen of Clubs. King of Hearts. Nine of Clubs. . Since the Simple Player does not have any diamonds in their hand to follow suit they would play the Nine of Hearts because it is the smallest card in their hand correct?. . Or because they have the Ace of Spades they would play that to follow the suit of the trump??. . I am just confused on what it means directly by follow suit, I think it means the led suit and nothing to do with the trump suit, but I want to make sure..
i_answer: "If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit. Otherwise, they play the lowest card in their hand.". . This is from the Spec's description of the Simple Player. Therefore, the simple player in this case would play the Nine of Hearts.

subject: player.cpp play_card
content: For all my if statements it says that the code won't be executable (I attached one if statement below). Am I erasing the card correctly? For each line marked code no executable it involves hand.erase statement..
i_answer: Once you return from a function, anything following your return statement will not be executed since your function has already "ended" at that point. If the erase() is happening right after a return statement, it will never actually execute.

subject: Lead_card
content: Am I thinking of lead_card correctly? I'm having some difficulties with the comparison statements (within using size_t to count what should be an integer value of TrumpCount but I don't how to compare it otherwise? Is this the right idea?.
i_answer: The overall structure looks really good! The simple player strategy for leading tricks basically boils down to two cases (all trump vs. at least one non-trump) and it looks like you're checking for which case you're in then handling each situation separately, which is a good approach. So, there might just be small things here and there you need to be careful of which you can expose through testing. . The size_t vs int comparison you're running into isn't a terribly big problem - it comes from the .size() method being of type size_t (which is basically an int, but its only positive numbers). You can work with just int variables, and everywhere you run into a size_t (when you call .size()), you can explicitly cast it to an int. . . Also, lead_card is played at the start of a trick, and since you play 5 tricks in a hand, it can be called with any number of cards in a player's hand - looks like you handle that in all your loops except on 154 when counting trump.

subject: Human player card playing rules
content: I'm not sure if we should check if humans abide by the rules.. . For instance, in the trick taking part, should we check the human's hand if he/she can follow suit and ask him/her to choose among those? Also, in the second round of making trump, if we reach a human dealer, should we enforce screw the dealer and make the decision for him/her?. . Although the spec said that we may assume humans follow the rules, it seems a little too vague for me so I want to double check.
i_answer: You do not have to check that the human player is following the rules, you can assume that they are. This means that when you play with a human player, make sure you are following the rules so you can check if everything is working properly.

subject: Passing Player's hand as a reference with const keyword
content: While implementing Player.cpp, I tried to create a helper function that sorts and prints a player's hand. Since sorting will change the hand's content, I'll need to pass it by reference. However, it appears that I must put the keyword const in order to pass the hand into the helper function outside of the class. This is a problem because const means that you cannot modify the contents of the variable.. . After some googling, I discovered that I can cast away the constness of hand with the const_cast operator, which solves the problem. I'm in the middle of debugging but the function seems to work fine for now. For the sake of good coding practice, is this allowed or recommended?
i_answer: I'm not super familiar with const_cast, but this seems like a nice post that summarizes how its used: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19554841/how-to-use-const-cast. Given that, I think it would be better to avoid it and try to respect the const-ness of a variable as much as possible (and only use const_cast if you absolutely have to). In Player.cpp, you shouldn't need to use const_cast though.. . You can make the helper function part of the Player class to avoid passing around a reference (see @1449 about Player.cpp helper functions). Or, you can think about if you really need to sort/modify the original through a reference for the purposes of printing - could it be okay to pass a copy of hand instead?

subject: Output of Euchre Test 01
content: I am testing my euchre.cpp file with the given test cases, and I've run into issues with test case 01.. . My issue happens when it is the 3rd hand. My program has Edsger passing in both rounds, but the correct output has "Edsger orders up Spades" in round 2.. . To narrow down the bug, I decided to print each player's hand after shuffling, but before they make trump. I am 99.9% certain my shuffle function works correctly, as I have manually checked its output extensively. That being said, Edsger's hand is:. Edsger's hand: [0] Jack of DiamondsEdsger's hand: [1] King of ClubsEdsger's hand: [2] Nine of ClubsEdsger's hand: [3] Ace of SpadesEdsger's hand: [4] Ten of Spades. during Hand 3. (the upcard is Queen of Clubs). . So, given that this is the correct hand, Edsger shouldn't order up spades (he's not the dealer). I am wondering if there is a nuance about the instructions that I am missing somewhere? (for example, I assume that I call my pack shuffle function once before each hand and this function performs the in-shuffle 7 times). . (Note: my autograder submission is not quite up to date as I am out of submissions for the day. I plan on submitting again tomorrow morning)
i_answer: Hmm, I would take another look at the Simple player round 2 making trump strategy (third paragraph in this section: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#making). Here's the relevant part:. ```. During round two, a Simple Player considers ordering up the suit with the same color as the upcard, which would make that suit trump. They will order up if that would mean they have one or more trump face cards in their hand (the right and left bowers, and Q, K, A of the order-up suit). ```. . In this case, the upcard suit was Clubs in round 1, however everyone passed so the upcard was flipped over. According to the simple strategy, in round 2 each simple player is now trying to order up the suit of the same color as the old upcard, so they're all trying to order up Spades. Specifically, they'll do so if they have at least 1 face card of that suit - Edsger is to the left of the dealer, so they get first choice. And since they have the Ace of Spades, they order up Spades. Hope that helps!

i_answer: You can just pass the stream in directly.. . ifstream pack_in("pack.in");. assert(pack_in.is_open());. Pack pack(pack_in);

subject: Problems testing a helper function
content: We're trying to make our own helper function in player.cpp but it's not letting us call the function in player_tests.cpp. Is there any possible solution to this you all may have in mind? We've tried putting our function "void sort_hand" inside the SimplePlayer class and outside of the class at the very top but neither seems to work. . This is what our implementation of the function looks like and it allows us to call the function within the class, just not in our player tests cpp file. We've also made sure we have the player and card header files #included in our test cases and #including the cpp file for player doesn't seem to help
i_answer: Unfortunately, there isn't really a way to test this helper function directly since in Player_tests, you can only test functions that are specified in Player.h. If you want to make sure that this helper function is working as expected, then you should use the visual debugger to step through your code. Regarding submitting tests to the autograder, since your helper function is called in other functions, you can submit tests for those other functions, which will indirectly test your helper function.

subject: For SimplePlayer, do we still need order_up_suit?
content: For HumanPlayer, I understand that we need to ask the user about what order_up_suit they want to pick. However, for SimplePlay, the order_up_suit is automatically decided once each player has a particular hand of cards: Round one-> tump suit; Round two-> next_suit of the trump suit.. Do we still need order_up_suit as a put-in parameter for the SimplePlayer-version make_trump()? My thinking is that it would be fixed based on their hands of cards and the strategy rule.
i_answer: Short answer is yes. The long answer is that "ordering up" a suit is just choosing if you like the suit of the face card based on what's in your hand, and would like that suit to be trump. For your simple player, make_trump should define if your player should or should not like the suit of the face card based on their hand. Make trump should modify order up suit if your code decides for the player to make the face suit trump. Look at making under euchre simple player strategy on the spec sheet for a better understanding.

subject: Definition of dealer, hand and trick
content: What does dealer, hand and trick actually mean? In this pdf, the round is just 1,2,3,4, but in my understanding, it can be larger than 4? . .
i_answer: Dealer: the player who deals out cards from the deck. The person to the left of them always starts when making trump, and the person to the left of them also leads the first trick.. Hand: a hand includes five tricks. It's called a hand because after dealing, each player has a hand of cards, all of which are used during the trick taking process. At the beginning of a hand, the pack is either shuffled or reset, and at the end the tricks are counted and points are scored.. Trick: one trip around the table of playing cards. A trick starts when a player leads a card, and ends when four cards are played and the winner of the trick is determined.. . This is telling you to use modular arithmetic to help keep track of who the dealer is. If the first dealer is player zero, the next is player one, then two, three, etc. The issue is that there is no player four (when counting from zero) because there are only four players in a game of euchre. However, notice that 4%4 == 0. The modulus operator helps you reset the dealer back to player zero after everyone's had a turn dealing.

subject: Game class deal cards function
content: in my Game class in euchre.cpp, I have a function that deals the cards to the player. I repeatedly call deal_one on my pack, and use add_card to add this dealt card to my players vector.. . In the spec, it says you give 3 cards to the player on the dealer's left, 2 cards to the next player on that person's left, and then give 3 cards to the player on the dealer's right, etc. However, when I step through this function, I'm getting an error that says I'm out of range of the players vector when I give 3 cards to the player on the dealer's right (libc++abi.dylib: terminating with uncaught exception of type std::out_of_range: vector).. . To give 3 cards to the player on the dealer's right, I add the cards to the players array at location (dealer - 1) % 4. I'm assuming since the dealer is at position 0, it doesn't like that it's taking the mod of a negative number. If this is the case, what would be the correct location in my players array <player1, player 2, player3, player4> to deal 3 cards to the dealer's right?
i_answer: You always go around the table to the left of the dealer, and the players are ordered so that (dealer + 1) % 4 is one to the left of the dealer.

subject: Code Duplication in Player.cpp
content: I submitted my code on Autograder and got this style error:. . . This snippet is for Simple Player. . SimplePlayer(std::string nameOfPlayer) {.    playerName = nameOfPlayer;.   }.   //EFFECTS returns player's name.   virtual const std::string & get_name() const {.    return playerName;.   }. .   //REQUIRES player has less than MAX_HAND_SIZE cards.   //EFFECTS  adds Card c to Player's hand.   virtual void add_card(const Card &c) {.    int playerHandSize = static_cast <int>(playerHand.size());.    assert(playerHandSize < MAX_HAND_SIZE);.    .    playerHand.push_back(c);.    std::sort(playerHand.begin(), playerHand.end());.   };. .   //REQUIRES round is 1 or 2.   //MODIFIES order_up_suit.   //EFFECTS If Player wishes to order up a trump suit then return true and.   //  change order_up_suit to desired suit.  If Player wishes to pass, then do.   //  not modify order_up_suit and return false..   virtual bool make_trump(const Card &upcard, bool is_dealer,.         int round, std::string &order_up_suit) const {.    assert(round == 1 || round == 2);.    int numFaceCard = 0;. . This snippet is for Human Player. . Human(std::string nameOfPlayer) {.    playerName = nameOfPlayer;.   }.   //EFFECTS returns player's name.   virtual const std::string & get_name() const {.    return playerName;.   }. .   //REQUIRES player has less than MAX_HAND_SIZE cards.   //EFFECTS  adds Card c to Player's hand.   virtual void add_card(const Card &c) {.    int playerHandSize = static_cast <int>(playerHand.size());.    assert(playerHandSize < MAX_HAND_SIZE);.    .    playerHand.push_back(c);.    std::sort(playerHand.begin(), playerHand.end());.   };. .   //REQUIRES round is 1 or 2.   //MODIFIES order_up_suit.   //EFFECTS If Player wishes to order up a trump suit then return true and.   //  change order_up_suit to desired suit.  If Player wishes to pass, then do.   //  not modify order_up_suit and return false..   virtual bool make_trump(const Card &upcard, bool is_dealer,.        int round, std::string &order_up_suit) const {.    assert(round == 1 || round == 2);.    int playerHandSize = static_cast <int>(playerHand.size());. I'm not able to figure out how to make the two snippets different from each other because the functionality of some of the methods for SimplePlayer and Human are the same and therefore the code must be the same. Are there any lecture notes/slides that I can refer to in order to avoid this type of style error?
i_answer: A good solution to this would be to factor out the common behavior into a helper function that you can call in each of the classes.

subject: SimplePlayer and HumanPlayer in euchre.cpp
content: Were we supposed to have HumanPlayer and SimplePlayer class included in the header files (only the function stubs and member variables, not actual implementation)? I am working on the Game ADT to be put on the euchre.cpp, but when I try to declare the member variable of the ADT with SimplePlayer or HumanPlayer, it states: . . Any help?
i_answer: There are a couple of things to note here. . SimplePlayer is not a member of Player, it is a derived class. Because of that, you don't need Player:: in front of SimplePlayer. Remember that the number of simple and human players will be specified by command line arguments at runtime. In other words, at compile time, you don't know how many simple players or how many human players to create. With that in mind, think about whether there is a way to create member variables in your Game class for each of the four players without knowing what type of player they are.

subject: Non-void function does not return a value in all control paths
content: I'm getting this error message: 'non-void function does not return a value in all control paths [-Werror,-Wreturn-type]' for 3 helper functions in Card.cpp. I get the error when I try to compile Card and Pack public tests.. . All of these functions have return statements that should always be executed though, which is why I'm confused. The return statements are nested in loops/if blocks. Does anyone have any advice? I can submit my code to the autograder if that would help!
i_answer: You simply need a return statement at the end of the function, outside of any if blocks/loops, even if this never gets reached. This will fix the error you're getting.

subject: sort and print
content: When we write the < operator for cards, do we have to consider the suit, for example, the diamond suit of 9 is larger than other suits of 9. Moreover, when we print the hand cards using sort, the led/trump cards will not necessarily be printed on the end since sort does not account for led or trump card cases, right?
i_answer: Operator< should use rank and break ties by suit.  Use: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cards. . If you print the cards in the hand using sort, led/trump will not be considered

subject: deal_one function
content: I understand that this should return the next card within the deck. However, if the next index is becomes greater than 23 than the card should not exist. It would be out of bound. When this happens, what should be done? . Should an error message be displayed?. . Should it reset the index next and return the first card? But could it be reset if all the cards have been dealt? . If it could be reset if all the cards have been dealt, would this be assuming that the time it's about to go out of bound is the time that they are going to have to deal cards again for the upcoming round?
i_answer: Consider using an assertion to check that you are not trying to deal past the last card. As you said, that is one messy issue to deal with.

subject: add_discard order
content: Does our add_and_discard function need to return the cards in ascending order while considering the upcard as trump? The way I had originally went about it I just replaced the lowest card with the upcard, but then I realized it would be out of order. But using the sort: function woulnd't really help because that doesn't take into account the trump suit? . void add_and_discard(const Card &upcard) override{.     int counter = 0;.     Card tempCard = player_card[0];.      for (int i = 1; i < static_cast<int>(player_card.size()); ++i) {.         if (Card_less(player_card[i], tempCard, upcard.get_suit())) {.          tempCard = player_card[i];.          counter = i;.         }.      }.      player_card[counter] = upcard;.       std::sort(player_card.begin(), player_card.end());.   }
i_answer: The add_and_discard function does not return anything, so you don't have to worry about the order of the cards. You can keep the cards in sorted order if you wish, but it is not a requirement.

As in one obvious strategy would be to create a new static size_t member variable in the Player class, that holds the same value as the MAX_HAND_SIZE; however, that would render the original MAX_HAND_SIZE redundant.. . . subject: add and discard in make trump

I am confused because don't we need to use that function add_and_discard, to add the upcard to the dealers hand and get rid of their worst card? or are we not supposed to be doing that in this function?
i_answer: You don't add or discard in make_trump.  The implementation of make_trump should only decide whether the Player wants to make trump

subject: Autograder inconsistency with Shuffle
content: Private because unsure if this breaks honor code, no code shared but output shared. (Let me know if I can make this public). . But, I need some clarification with shuffle. . . . The top is the order that is being used for shuffle (confirmed in @1766 ), and the bottom is the output from my shuffle function.. . It correctly shuffles the deck and the first card is King of Clubs.. . however, in the autograder, my code is outputting King of Spades as the first card. Is there a reason for this inconsistency?. . reference:. .
i_answer: Your default Pack constructor is initializing the cards array in the incorrect order.  I.e. you're Pack default constructor sets cards[0]=Nine of spades, cards[1]=Nine of Hearts, cards[2]=Nine of Clubs, and then cards[3]=Nine of Diamonds, etc. when the actual order should follow the contents of Pack.in, i.e. cards[0]=Nine of Spades, cards[1]=Ten of Spades, cards[2]=Jack of Spades, etc.

subject: sort cards
content: If we are not considering the trump in the operator of comparing cards, how can we make sure that the sorted vector of cards has trump cards at the end if the sort function is depending on the operator?
i_answer: The spec asks you to sort the vector as defined by the < operator for Card, so the sort would not take trump/the led card into consideration.

subject: Euchre simple player behavior
content: Hi, was just wondering why Dabbala chooses Queen of Clubs in this scenario:. According to the simple player behavior, simple players should only consider the suit that was led, and thusly will either a) play the highest led suit card in their hand or if they have no led suit cards b) play the lowest card in their hand. Following this logic, shouldn't Dabbala play the Nine of Hearts here (considering trump card isn't taken into account)? I don't get why she plays the Queen of Clubs instead.
i_answer: You're supposed to take the trump card into account. When they say that only the led card is considered, they're not saying that trump is ignored, they're saying that we ignore what the other players have played.

subject: add_and_discard

subject: make_trump
content: If it is the 2nd round and is_dealer is false and there is not >= 1 trump face card in the simple player's suit, then we should return false right? But what if all the above applies except is_dealer is true, since I understand we must perform screw the dealer, so then should we return true if it is the 2nd round and is_dealer is true regardless of the dealer's hand?
i_answer: In short, yes. Screw the dealer means that the dealer must call trump. In this case, the simple player will always order up the suit of the same color as the upcard.

Something similar happens in later rounds with the nine of spades and the nine of diamonds, but that was the case I looked at most thoroughly.. . This is my shuffle function:. . . Can anyone help with this issue? Thank you so much.
i_answer: Never mind! It wasn't a shuffle issue and I figured it out

subject: Card_less function
content: Hello, . My card_less function is failing and i'm not sure where i'm going wrong. I've gone through the logic multiple times and it seems to make sense. Is this something I can get help on? I have pasted my code below.. . Thanks in advance!. . . bool Card_less(const Card &a, const Card &b, const Card &led_card,. const std::string &trump) {. int aRank = 0;. int bRank = 0;. while (a.get_rank() != RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[aRank]) {. ++aRank;. }. while (b.get_rank() != RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[bRank]) {. ++bRank;. }. . int aSuit = 0;. int bSuit = 0;. while (a.get_suit() != SUIT_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[aSuit]) {. ++aSuit;. }. while (b.get_suit() != SUIT_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[bSuit]) {. ++bSuit;. }. . if (a.get_suit() == trump && b.get_suit() != trump) {. return false;. } else if (a.get_suit() != trump && b.get_suit() == trump) {. return true;. } else if (a.get_suit() == trump && b.get_suit() == trump) {. if (aRank < bRank) {. return true;. } else {. return false;. }. } else if (led_card.get_suit() == trump) { //?. if (aRank < bRank) {. return true;. } else {. return false;. }. } else if (a.get_suit() != trump && b.get_suit() != trump) {. if (a.get_suit() != led_card.get_suit() && b.get_suit() == led_card.get_suit()) {. return true;. } else if (a.get_suit() == led_card.get_suit() && b.get_suit() != led_card.get_suit()) {. return false;. } else if (a.get_suit() == led_card.get_suit() && b.get_suit() == led_card.get_suit()) {. if (aRank < bRank) {. return true;. } else {. return false;. }. }. } else if (a.get_suit() != led_card.get_suit() && b.get_suit() != led_card.get_suit()) {. if (aRank < bRank) {. return true;. } else if (aRank > bRank) {. return false;. } else{. if (aSuit < bSuit) {. return true;. }. . }. . }return false;. }.
i_answer: One of the tricky parts about Euchre is handling the right and left bowers (the jack of the trump suit and the jack of the next suit, respectively). These cards have the two highest values in the game (with the left bower being lower valued than the right bower). This function needs to account for the case where a and/or b are the bowers.

subject: make_trump round 2
content: For round two of make_trump, it says to order up the suit with the same color as the upward. What if a hand has both colors, which suit do they order up? . .
i_answer: What color cards are in the hand do not matter. Only the color of the upcard matters. And there can only be one upcard.

subject: play_card erase issue
content: I keep getting an error saying, Error: attempt to erase from container with a past-the-end iterator when I am writing my simple player function. With the bounds of the loop I don't understand how this could be an error? I know we need to get rid of the card once its played.. . Card play_card(const Card &led_card, const std::string &trump) override{.     Card tempCard;.     bool nonleadCard = false;.     int i;.     for (i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(player_card.size()); i++) {.       if (player_card[i].get_suit() == led_card.get_suit() && nonleadCard == false) {.           tempCard = player_card[i];.           nonleadCard = true;.       }.       else if (player_card[i].get_suit() == led_card.get_suit().               && nonleadCard && Card_less(tempCard, player_card[i], trump)) {.         tempCard = player_card[i];.       }.     }.     if(!nonleadCard) {.       tempCard = player_card[0];.       int j;.       for (j = 1; j < static_cast<int>(player_card.size()); j++) {.         if(Card_less(player_card[j], tempCard, trump)){.           tempCard = player_card[j];.         }.       }.       i = j;.     }.     player_card.erase(player_card.begin() + i);.     return tempCard;. .   }
i_answer: In your for loop, iwill increment to the size of the hand and you may potentially not enter the if statement if(!nonleadCard) {. In this case, i will be one past the end of the hand as the hand is 0 indexed.. . For example, if your hand is size 5, i will get to value 5, terminate the first for loop since 5 is not less than 5, potentially not enter the if statement, and then you have the value of 5 for i. This would then cause you to attempt to erase something outside of your vector.

subject: Segmentation fault with pack.cpp
content: Hi, . . When we try to run the public tests for pack, we're getting a segmentation fault and it says "Thread 1: hit program assert" at the line in the public tests where it says to assert that the pack.in file is open. We aren't sure how to fix this because pack.in is in the folder, and would appreciate any assistance. I've attached a screenshot of the thread 1 error and our Pack function. Screen_Shot_2021-10-16_at_4.58.52_PM.png. Screen_Shot_2021-10-16_at_4.42.53_PM.png
i_answer: It looks like you're using Xcode.  Make sure you've updated the custom working directory setting.. . @1449. . Q: Why won't pack.in open in pack public tests when running on Xcode?. Click on the name of your scheme in the toolbar at the top left, Edit Scheme > Options > Enable "Custom Working Directory" and press the little folder icon. Pick the folder that contains your code along with pack.in. This will ensure that the file is visible to your executable..

subject: Works if I deal then shuffle but not if I shuffle then deal
content: Has anyone tried testing for pack.cpp and had the problem where the test works if deal and then shuffle but it doesn't work if I shuffle and then deal?
i_answer: If your test is checking that the right cards were dealt, then whether or not the pack was shuffled is important. In other words, if you shuffle first, then deal, players would get different cards than if you dealt first (with un-shuffled cards), then shuffled (which wouldn't affect that cards you already dealt).. . It would help to look at the test case in question, so if you have any more questions, feel free to make this post private and post a snippet of that test!

subject: valgrind error for player
content: How can I resolve the error "Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s)"?
i_answer: Valgrind is giving you an error because you're doing something like the following. . int i;. if (i < 3) {.     cout << "i is less than 3" << endl;. }. This code causes undefined behavior because i is never initialized and only contains a junk value. Look for the line number valgrind refers you to, and find the variables used in that condition and make sure they are given an initial value.

content: . . This error is showing up for both myself and my partner's code, and we're not sure why-- private post because I'm including out get_name and make_trump codes below!. . . virtual const string& get_name() {.         return name;.     }. // same code for human and simple. .  virtual bool make_trump(const Card& upcard, bool is_dealer,.         int round, std::string& order_up_suit) {. .         int count = 0; // will be used soon. . .        // round 1 and round 2 are different.         if (round == 1) {. .             // 1. "consider the suit of the upcard." .             string upcard_suit = upcard.get_suit();. . .             // 2. "Will order up if 2+ trump faces in hand".             // use Card::is_face() and Card::is_trump(upcard). .             for (int i = 0; i < hand.size(); ++i) { .                 if (hand[i].is_face() && hand[i].is_trump(upcard.get_suit())) {. . .                     count++;.                 }.             }.             if (count >= 2) {.                 // turns out this is when i use upcard_suit lol. .                 order_up_suit = upcard_suit;.                 return true;.             }.             else {.                 return false;.             }.         }. .         if (round == 2) {.             if (is_dealer) { // get this out of the way 1st. .                 order_up_suit = Suit_next(upcard.get_suit());. .                 // "always order up the suit with the same color as the upcard.".                 return true;.             }. .             else {. .                 for (int i = 0; i < hand.size(); ++i) {. .                     // "one or more trump face cards in their hand".                     if (hand[i].is_face() && hand[i].is_trump(upcard.get_suit())) {.                         count++;.                     }.                 }.                 if (count >= 1) {.         .                     order_up_suit = Suit_next(upcard.get_suit());. .                     return true;.                 }.                 else {.                     return false;.                 }.             }.         }. .         else {.             return false;.             // is this what to do if round != 1 or 2.         }. ^ Simple make_trump. . . int round, std::string& order_up_suit) {. .         string choice;.         sort(hand.begin(), hand.end());. .         // replace this w/ the hand print helper function!!.         for (int i = 0; i < hand.size(); ++i) {.             cout << hand[i].get_rank() << " of " << hand[i].get_suit() << endl;.         }. .         cout << "Human player " << get_name() << ", please enter a suit, or pass: ";.         cin >> choice;. . . .         if (choice == "Spades") {.             order_up_suit = Card::SUIT_SPADES;.             return true;.         }.         else if (choice == "Diamonds") {.             order_up_suit = Card::SUIT_DIAMONDS;.             return true;.         }.         else if (choice == "Clubs") {.             order_up_suit = Card::SUIT_CLUBS;.             return true;.         }.         else if (choice == "Hearts") {.             order_up_suit = Card::SUIT_HEARTS;.             return true;.         }.         else if (choice == "pass") {.             return false;.         }. Human make_trump ^Any help would be greatly appreciated! Thank you!
i_answer: The get_name() function you are attempting to override is a const function.  I.e. the function signature of get_name is:. . const string& get_name() const { // implementation }. there is another const keyword after the parameter list that your current code is missing and thus isn't a proper override of the get_name function in the parent class.  It's the same issue with make_trump

subject: Boolean operator functions
content: Discovered that my comparison operators were not working properly per @1815, in the process of debugging, I realized I need to also check for the suit.   To properly order the operators for ties of suit etc, I'm curious if this sort of format will work (I was originally going with what the spec intro to boolean operators showed as the 'thing' example but I took it too literally):. . . Additionally:  I'm not sure how to structure comparison for the rank and suit weights in these boolean operator classes, seeing as presently it is comparing string ascii values.. This is what I was trying to do to get around that:. . . thanks
i_answer: As the code stands right now, you are comparing a string to another string, which will not always return what you want it to (Consider a Spades vs. a Diamond card, which will return that Spades is greater because S is greater than D).  You are correct to try to rank instead by index in the array than the pure string value.. . The other thing that you need to consider is that you should first weigh cards by its rank and only check suit if the ranks are the same. Looking at your first screenshot, you are checking both rank and suit regardless of if the ranks are the same.

subject: How can we assure the human player is inputting correctly?
content: When the human player leads, they'll get this message printed (directly from the spec) :. . . . Human player Judea's hand: [0] Nine of Spades. Human player Judea's hand: [1] Ten of Spades. Human player Judea's hand: [2] Jack of Spades. Human player Judea's hand: [3] King of Hearts. Human player Judea's hand: [4] Ace of Hearts. Human player Judea, please enter a suit, or "pass":. . . . When they enter a suit, how do we assure that our code will accept "SPADES/Spades/spades" etc or do we just assume they'll do it a certain way?.
i_answer: To supplement the student answer, we assume the human player will play correctly.

subject: make_trump: order_up_suit when player passes
content: When make_trump returns true, order_up_suit either gets set to the suit of the upcard or the next suit of the same color. But what should order_up_suit be set to if make_trump returns false and the player passes? Should it just be an empty string?
i_answer: If make trump returns false, the RME says that you should not modify order_up_suit at all.

subject: Simple Player Making Trump
content: I am a little confused by the logic a simple player will use in round 1 to determine if they should order up trump.. . The PDF says: "Bob uses the strategy of a Simple Player, and will only order up if he has atleast 2 face cards of the same suit as the upcard.". . The Spec says: "During round one, a Simple Player considers ordering up the suit of the upcard, which would make that suit trump. They will order up if that would mean they have two or more trump face cards in their hand. Trump face cards are the right and left bowers, and Q, K, A of the trump suit, which is the suit proposed by the upcard. (A Simple Player does not consider whether they are the dealer and could gain an additional trump by picking up the upcard.)". . My question is what should happen in the specific case that the player is the dealer, the upcard is a face card, and the player's hand currently has exactly one trump face card?. . By the PDF explanation, the Simple player would not order up since he doesn't have 2+ trump face cards. However, the Spec explanation says Simple player would order up since by picking up the upcard, he now has two trump face cards.
i_answer: In the spec, it says "a simple player does not consider whether they are the dealer and could gain an additional trump by picking up the upcard." I think by that logic, the dealer would not order up.

subject: Euchre rules
content: When the trump and lead suit are the same, for example, both are spades, and a simple player has a nine of spades and a jack of clubs, since they would play the highest value card that follows suit, would that be the nine of spades or the jack of clubs? Thank you!
i_answer: The jack of clubs

subject: Worried about Honor Code Violation

In my code I used card_less to in similar way to find the min and max card in Player.cpp. Seeing that they posted code that uses the same function as I did in a similar style and last week my professor had someone from the honor code office come and talk to us, it made me worried. But, it still makes me worried seeing similarities in our code and I do not want an honor code violation. Below is 2 spots in my Player.cpp where I find the min and the max card in the hand showing how I implemented card_less. I figured asking on piazza would be a good place to start since you guys all see a lot of code, and I am hoping you guys just say that it is just a common execution and I will not have anything to worry about. Thank you so much for your time, I look forward to hearing back from you.. . .
i_answer: Yeah you're totally fine. The functionality of this helper function is necessary in your project somewhere. It's important to know that if you didn't copy code directly from someone/somewhere else, you won't find yourself in an honor code situation.

subject: Testing Shuffle
content: Hi! I think @1523 started to address this but I'm not quite sure how to test shuffle properly. Do I have to make a new pack and manually input what the shuffled deck should be or is there a more simple way to do this?
i_answer: One neat little fact about in-shuffles is that if you do them enough times then they'll eventually re-sort the deck. In the case of an in-shuffle, if you perform it 20 times on a deck of 24 cards it should just give you back the original deck. Hopefully this can help shorten your test code a bit.

subject: What should be printed in the making phase if it gets back to the dealer in the second round?
content: In the first round and the first three parts of the second round of making, for a human player we print something like this: "Human player Judea, please enter a suit, or "pass":". However, at the end of the second round the dealer has to order up so should we print something else since they don't have the choice to pass or just print the same message since they will always follow the rules?
i_answer: The spec says "This procedure is the same for both rounds of making trump." in reference to listing out the cards in the player's hand and then asking if they want to pick a card or pass. You are allowed to assume a player will never cheat.

subject: Additionally, How do I Check if Something is an Object?
content: Besides making a function, bool isSimplePlayer() or isHumanPlayer() in the respective class, how can I check whether something is a Simple Player, or whether it's a Human Player?
i_answer: You shouldn't need to check. Since we are implementing all Player base class pure virtual functions in our derived classes, we can use dynamic binding without worry to choose the right "version" of the function.

subject: Player public test passing on VS Code but not on Autograder
content: Anybody else have this error where the Player public test is passing on their compiler but does not go through on Autograder?. . In the run section it stops here:. . But on Valgrind this is what shows up:. . Is this a Valgrind error or something else? If it was just a Valgrind error then why does run show up as red?.
i_answer: So what this is telling you is that you have some if statement somewhere (or something similar) which uses an uninitialized value. What this means is that you're reading junk data because you never initialized it, so it's essentially random and it'll run differently on different computers because of that, which explains why it failed on the autograder. Follow valgrind's error back to where it occurred so you can correctly initialize your variables.

subject: Card_less Scenario
content: Hey,. . I was kinda confused on the Card_less function that takes into account the led suit.. . So if I had a scenario:. . Card 1: Ace of Hearts, Card 2: Two of Clubs, Led Card: Jack of Clubs, Trump: Spades. . Wouldn't this be that card 1 is less than card 2 because card 2's suit is the led suit, which is greater than card 1, a non-trump/led card? Thanks.. . Daniel
i_answer: The led suit in this case is Spades because the Jack of Clubs is the left bower.  Since Card 1 and Card 2 both aren't the same suit as the led card nor a trump suit, then Card 1 is greater than Card 2

Pack::Pack() {. //loop through array (double for) loop suits, ranks. // add cards at suit weight and rank. // Card constructor. // Card("RANK_TWO", "SUIT_SPADES");. for (int count = 0; count < PACK_SIZE; ++count) {. for (int suit = 0; suit < 4; ++suit) {. for (int rank = 0; rank < 13; ++rank) {. cards[count] = Card(RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[rank], SUIT_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[suit]);. }. }. }. }. . // REQUIRES: pack_input contains a representation of a Pack in the. // format required by the project specification. // MODIFIES: pack_input. // EFFECTS: Initializes Pack by reading from pack_input.. Card Pack::deal_one() { // Pack:: include. ++next;. return cards[--next];. }. . // EFFECTS: Resets next index to first card in the Pack. void Pack::reset() {. next = 0;. }. . // EFFECTS: Shuffles the Pack and resets the next index. This. // performs an in shuffle seven times. See. // https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_shuffle.. void Pack::shuffle() {. std::array<Card, PACK_SIZE> shuffle;. std::array<Card, (PACK_SIZE/2)> arrayBottom;. std::array<Card, (PACK_SIZE/2)> arrayTop;. . for (int j = 0; j < 7; ++j) {. . for (int t = 0; t < PACK_SIZE/2; ++t) {. arrayBottom[t] = cards[t];. }. . for (int b = 0; b < PACK_SIZE/2; ++b){. arrayTop[b] = cards[b + (PACK_SIZE/2)];. }. . for (int a = 0; a < PACK_SIZE/2; a++) { // shuffle array. for (int b = 0; b < PACK_SIZE/2; b++) { // top array. for (int c = 0; c < PACK_SIZE/2; c++) { // bottom array. shuffle[a] = arrayTop[b];. shuffle[a + 1] = arrayBottom[c];. }. }. }. }. // cut the deck. // 2 new arrays. // add array1[0] then array2[0], then array1[1], then array2[1]. // does every deck have even number?. // array1 is first half, array2 is second half. array2 first (DOUBLE CHECK).. // Do 7 times, for loop. }. . // EFFECTS: returns true if there are no more cards left in the pack. bool Pack::empty() const {. return next != PACK_SIZE; // this is a new change. }. . When I try to run Pack.cpp, I get a segmentation fault. I think the problem is in shuffle but I have no idea what the problem is and I none of my changes change the segmentation fault
