subject: Using the sort function
content: I am confused by when/where we can use the sort function.. Can we use it in the add_and_discard function for instance to order the cards to smallest to largest? Or are we supposed to only use it when were printing the hands? I read an earlier discussion about being wary of using it in functions with const, but I did not fully understand the instructor's response.
i_answer: You should be free to modify the order of the hand however/whenever you need to, so you're allowed to sort the hand in add_and_discard if you have a need for it. . . The reason you need to consider const functions is because they aren't allowed to modify the member variables of a class, so you wouldn't be able to sort the player's hand from within a const function since that would mean modifying it. If you do need the hand in sorted order inside of a const function, you'll have to think about ways to create that without modifying the original player hand

subject: Inconsistent Spacing | euchre_test50.out.correct
content: When ordering up in the human public test, I saw that the spacing afterwards was inconsistent in the .correct file.. . Here there are two line breaks after ordering up.However, here there is only one line break after ordering up.I redownloaded this file to verify I didn't accidentally mess with it.In the other .correct files, there is a blank line between ordering up and the next terminal output.Do we need to account for this?
i_answer: In the first screenshot, trump is made during round 2.  In the second screenshot, trump is made during round 1.  In round 1, the dealer has to choose a card to discard whereas in round 2, the dealer does not discard a card.  The spacing in the second screenshot (or lack thereof a newline) is due to the output of asking the dealer to choose a card to discard.. . So yes you do need to account for this case, to answer your question.  Recall from the spec in Appendix B:. . Print an extra newline when making, adding, and discarding is done..

subject: assigning dealer
content: I am currently struggling to come up with a method to assign the role of dealer to a specific player. Currently I am attempting to use my Game ADT (that has private members of the Player class) with a make_dealer function but I can't access the private dealer variable in either of the derived player classes from my Game ADT. Any tips or suggestions on how to do this or use a different method?
i_answer: I would consider the scope of who needs to know who the dealer is. The Player class models the individual player's responsibilities and actions, and any individual player, in isolation, does not need to know who the dealer is. However, in the scope of the game, everyone needs to know who the dealer is (or at least you need to keep track of it). Think about how you are storing your players for the game and what game-scoped identifier you could use to keep track of who the dealer is at any point in time.. .

subject: Shuffle in Pack.cpp
content: . I'm having trouble writing the shuffle function and I'm not exactly sure where I'm going wrong in the code. What does it mean for std::bad alloc?. .
i_answer: `std::bad_alloc` means something went wrong with trying to allocate new memory - it's weird that its happening for this test though.. . One observation is that in your inner for-loops, after you set the card into left and right, you do `z += 2`, where z is the index of your middle for-loop. Generally, you want to avoid modifying the loop index inside of the loop since that's usually handled by the for-loop itself (that's the last part in `for (int z = 0; z < PACK_SIZE; ++z)`) and you can end up skipping indices unintentionally. In this case, you'll be updating z by 3 every iteration of the loop - you'd do += 2 inside the loop, then at the end you'll do ++ again because of the loop definition.. . Another thing is that you don't use right or left, so the pack doesn't end up getting shuffled after you call shuffle - somewhere in this function, you need to set the the values of cards.. . For the shuffle logic, I think you're on the right track - I would make sure that you're breaking up the steps properly to perform an in-shuffle. So *first*, get the left and right half of the pack, *then* use those to set each card in pack according to the appropriate index (currently you're getting the left and right half for every index of card, since you have those loops inside the z for-loop).

subject: Help with shuffle
content: I have submitted my files on autograder so that you can see my code. I am having trouble trying to implement the shuffle function in pack.cpp. Right now, I have the function only shuffling once so that I can see the output when running the public test. Next seems to be stuck at 23 even though I am resetting it(when I call the public test), so I am not sure if it is a problem with my other functions or my implementation. I would appreciate any help, thank you.
i_answer: I think it could be an issue with how you're setting cards from lhs and rhs back into cards. For example:. ```. for(int outer_e = 0; outer_e < 24; outer_e+=2){ .       for(int inner_e = 0; inner_e < 12; ++inner_e){.         cards[outer_e] = rhs[inner_e];  .       }. }. ```. I believe you're trying to set every other index in cards according to the cards in rhs, however the nested loop is problematic. To see that, thing about what happens when outer_e = 0 - we're trying to set the first card in pack equal to the first card in rhs, however we end up running the entire inner for loop for inner_e = 0 all the way up to inner_e = 11, so we really end up setting it to rhs[11], and that happens for all outer_e. To fix this, think about how you might use a single for loop to go through both cards and rhs (same with cards and lhs), using math to make sure the indices work out.. . Also, I would avoid hard-coding numbers like 12 or 24 - prefer to use `PACK_SIZE / 2` and `PACK_SIZE` for more flexible code. .

Valgrind gives you line numbers to start on, check out line 2 of the valgrind output for a place to start debugging!

subject: Shuffle after every hand
content: In the main function of euchre, do we need to shuffle after every hand if shuffling is enabled?
i_answer: You should shuffle after every hand

subject: Test make trump round 2
content: What is the better practice for testing make trump round 2? Should we assume that make trump round 1 is already called and has worked as intended?  We will of course test for buggy implementations of make trump round 1 using another set of tests.. . For example, is it redundant to include a test case where the player's hand contains three face cards in the upcard suit? This certainly should have been resolved in the first round of making.
i_answer: My general philosophy is that you can never be too thorough with testing, sometimes it's the tests you see as "redundant" that end up exposing a bug you would've missed otherwise. In this case, it does make sense that it may not be useful to check a case that should have already been caught, but it's up to your discretion if you would like to  double check.

subject: Autograder Compile
content: When I run player_public_tests in XCode, it compiles and passes fine, and then when I submit to Autograder, it doesn't compile and I get this message. . . . Player.cpp:10:18: fatal error: Pack.h: No such file or directory. . How do I fix this issue?
i_answer: Player.cpp should not depend on Pack.h, so you shouldn’t include it at the top of Player.cpp.

subject: Using Suit_next
content: Even though Suit_next is not within the Card class (it's a function outside the class but in the same cpp file), would it be okay to call it from a function inside the class to reuse that code?. . If doing this is acceptable, was there a specific reason why Suit_next was not originally within the class as a static function?
i_answer: Calling non-member functions within member functions is totally fine an often helpful (you get to reuse code you've written).. . When figuring out which functions should be class members, it is important to think about responsibilities. -- Should this functionality be the responsibility of class X // should this functionality be performed by class X? If the answer to either of these is a clear "yes," consider making the function a member function. In this case, getting the next suit is more of a helper function than a core responsibility of a generic card (not one specifically made for euchre), and that is why is it not a Card member function.. . This is just my opinion, by the way, as nuances in code style and architecture often come down to personal preference and readability

subject: Assumptions about sorted hands
content: In Player, we are writing our functions assuming that the hand is already sorted. Is this a correct assumption to make (based on the spec versus effects of the RMEs for Player functions). If not, how do we go about writing helper functions for sorting, seeing that we can't use 'hand' in a static function.. . We sort the hand (with no regard to trump) before make_trump, but after that we just assume that we will have a hand sorted with regard to trump (implemented later in euchre.cpp). Is this correct thinking?. . uniqname: brogan and jbruzek. Screen_Shot_2021-10-14_at_10.06.21_PM.png
i_answer: Whether or not you can assume the hand is sorted will depend on your code. Think about where you are sorting your hand, and then justify whether or not your functions can assume if a hand is sorted.. . As far as writing helper functions for sort, keep in mind you are welcome to use the sort function from the algorithm library

subject: github Does not pull
content: After setting up GitHub from the mega tutorial, It does not let me commit any files or pull any files from. the master folder. I have been granted access as a maintainer with all these privileges but It still does not seem to work. Any ideas?
i_answer: Can you post the error message you are receiving?. . When you make a commit it is happening locally, a push actually sends that commit to github.. If you’re unable to commit, make sure you have staged files to commit: git add (filename). Alternatively you can commit with the -a flag for all changes: git commit -a -m “your message”. . You should also make sure your folder is set up as a git repository in the first place. However if there’s already a repo on github, then you need to clone that repository instead of trying to use any existing code folder. .

subject: Question P-3
content: Hi, Do we need two tests of a different, that is implementing the same thing? If you are not understanding, my question, I am giving you an example here:. . For example:. . . TEST(simple_player_lead2). {.     Player* uma = Player_factory("Uma", "Simple");.     string trump = Card::SUIT_DIAMONDS;.     Card NineOfClubs(Card::RANK_NINE, Card::SUIT_CLUBS);.     Card QueenOfClubs(Card::RANK_QUEEN, Card::SUIT_CLUBS);.     Card QueenOfHearts(Card::RANK_QUEEN, Card::SUIT_HEARTS);.     Card JackOfHearts(Card::RANK_JACK, Card::SUIT_HEARTS);.     uma -> add_card(NineOfClubs);.     uma -> add_card(QueenOfClubs);.     uma -> add_card(QueenOfHearts);.     uma -> add_card(JackOfHearts);.     ASSERT_EQUAL(uma -> lead_card(trump), QueenOfClubs);.     delete uma;. }. . . . . TEST(simple_player_lead3). {.     Player* uma = Player_factory("Uma", "Simple");.     string trump = Card::SUIT_DIAMONDS;.     Card NineOfClubs(Card::RANK_NINE, Card::SUIT_CLUBS);.     Card QueenOfClubs(Card::RANK_QUEEN, Card::SUIT_CLUBS);.     Card QueenOfHearts(Card::RANK_QUEEN, Card::SUIT_HEARTS);.     Card JackOfHearts(Card::RANK_JACK, Card::SUIT_HEARTS);.     uma -> add_card(NineOfClubs);.     uma -> add_card(QueenOfClubs);.     uma -> add_card(QueenOfHearts);.     uma -> add_card(JackOfHearts);.     ASSERT_EQUAL(uma -> lead_card(trump), QueenOfClubs);.     delete uma;. }. . . . Is it okay to do this?
i_answer: If I'm understanding correctly, these tests are identical except for their name. You should not do this, your tests should be unique

subject: Question about shuffle
content: Hi . I am confused about how the shuffle work, let's say there are cards:. 1 2 3 4....21 22 23 24, so for the first in-shuffle, the sequence changes into:. 2 1 3 4....21 22 24 23. how does the second shuffle work? Do we move on on 3 and 4, 21 and 22?.
i_answer: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Faro_shuffle#Perfect_shuffles. . The first example shows a good visual of doing an in-shuffle three times with 6 cards.

subject: Where to start with euchre.cpp
content: I'm lost trying to figure out how to write the driver file, I understand that we have to make a Game ADT, but besides that I don't exactly know what functions we should be making inside of it.
i_answer: Play a round of Euchre with yourself and note all the other actions that you have to take. Making those actions into functions is probably a good place to start. Remember we still only get 40 lines for the main function

subject: static keyword
content: Player class uses a. . static const int MAX_HAND_SIZE variable.. What does the static keyword in front mean?.
i_answer: It means that only one instance of that MAX_HAND_SIZE variable exist throughout the application's lifetime.

subject: Tons of command line errors that are Mac-specific (maybe have to do with swap)
content: I'm getting these horrible errors that show up every time I try to run the Player public test that take up my entire screen and like pages of the command line. Seems like they are Mac specific too and maybe have to do with a sort function, any solution to this?.
i_answer: This error usually occurs because you are trying to modify your vector of Cards inside of a const function.  Since const functions makes *this (i.e. the object pointed to by this) const, then you cannot modify any of the member variables of the class inside of that function implementation.  If you, for example, tried calling std::sort on a member variable inside a const function, then it will cause a compilation error because you are attempting to modify something that is temporarily const.

subject: Sorting in make_trump function

However, because the make_trump function is const it won't let us sort the players hand? Is there some way we should be printing out the cards in ascending order without printing the hand?

subject: What Card To Lead If Tie
content: Hello,. My partner and I have gotten everything working except what card to lead in case of a tie. An example would be hand 4 for the second public euchre test. Herb has 3 aces, what determines which ace he leads? It’s not the weight of the suits because he plays Spades second, it’s not order of hand or reverse order of hand because Edsger in the same hand has a ten of spades and ten of clubs. We’re just confused.
i_answer: It is determined by the weight of the suits. In the specs it specifies that "they play the highest non-trump card in their hand", which in this case is the Aces of Hearts. Note that Spades is the lowest suit.

subject: Testing add and discard
content: Is there a way we can test add and discard? Considering that we cannot access the member values.

subject: Trump Suit Making Process Clarification
content: So I'm testing my euchre.cpp class and I am a little confused on the trump card making portion. So say that in the trump making portion, Jack of Diamonds turns up as a trump card to be considered, and the making trump process starts. Eventually, one of the players ends up ordering up Hearts as the trump suit. So would Hearts be considered the trump suit instead of Diamonds?
i_answer: Assuming that no one ordered up in the first round of making trump, and in the second round, someone ordered up hearts as the trump suit, yes hearts would be the trump suit.

subject: contains function in vector?
content: Is there a function for vectors that checks whether an element exists in a vector?
i_answer: No, but feel free to write a helper function!. . edit: there is in the algorithm library (see find and find_if), but for this project, you are only allowed to use sort from the algorithm library and no other functions. .

subject: euchre rules
content: It said in the spec that in round 1, the upcard's suit is the possible trump suit, but later in the Player behavior spec section, it says: . . Basically, that any suit can be the trump for both rounds. Am I interpreting this wrong?
i_answer: We are assuming the player would be following the rules. You just need to read in their input and set the order up suit as whatever the human player types (or pass) and return true or false appropriately.

subject: sort a vector with Card_less
content: Hi, I was trying to sort the vector with following statement, but it seems that it does not take trump into account. I have finished card.cpp and card_tests.cpp(with many edge cases). They seem to run well, and I think there is no problem with my Card_less function.
i_answer: You can do a regular sort:   sort(not_suit.begin(), not_suit.end()) , since you've already defined an operator that can compare cards, it will be used to order the cards automatically

subject: Default Player Constructors
content: . What should the default constructors for these Derived Classes be? Should there be one?
i_answer: Every class requires at least one constructor, so one should exist for each of the derived classes. You are allowed to write these as you please, but think about what you will be passing through as you create players for your game.

subject: Returning values from if statements in functions
content: I'm writing a function with multiple if statements. If the first if statement is satisfied and returns a value to the function, will the function still continue to read the second if statement or does it automatically stop and return the first if statement's return value?
i_answer: Hitting a return statement anywhere will cause the function to stop execution. Be careful, though, sometimes compilers don't like this in the case where you don't have an else statement and there's a "chance" you hit the end of a non-void function.

subject: question about make_trump
content: In the simple player part, the instruction said that during the second round of making trump, if the robot is the dealer, then "the dealer will always order up the suit with the same color as the upcard". However, what if the dealer does not have a suit with the same color? for example:. . robot's hand:. {nine of spades, ten of spades, jack of spades, nine of clubs, ten of clubs}(all black suits, and none qualified for order up in the first round). . the upcard:. nine of heart(red suits). . In this case, which suit should the robot order?
i_answer: You can order up a suit even if you don't have any card of that suit in your hand.

subject: Printing pass and order up for human player
content: For the human player, it says you print the decision of whether the player decides to pass or order up. For example, "Judea passes" and "Judea orders up hearts". Is this something we should print in the Human player class member function or something we should print in euchre.cpp?
i_answer: Printing the decision is not unique to the human player. You will need to do the same for a simple player as well. Those print statements (___ passes, ____ orders up ____) should be put into your driver program

I included make_trump in both Human and Simple, so theoretically it should be able to instantiate. Any help is appreciated.
i_answer: Resolved. This is exactly the reason we use the override keyword

subject: Project 3 Strange Error When Running Pack_public_test.exe
content: Hello,. . I experienced a very strange series of errors today while trying to debug my functions in my Pack.cpp file. I tried going to office hours, and the instructor that I spoke to said that all of my code, at least on the surface, looked sound, and that I didn't seem to be doing anything that could cause errors like the ones I was experiencing. They noted that it was really unusual and recommended I make a Piazza post to ask if anyone could provide any guidance on what might be going wrong?. . I provided a screenshot of my terminal below (Screenshot 13), and I privated this post so that I could include the code for my Pack functions as well (Screenshots 14, 15, 17, and 18). . . Screenshot_(13).png. Screenshot_(14).png. Screenshot_(15).png. Screenshot_(17).png. Screenshot_(18).png. . Thanks,. . Lisa Tarsavage. . Edit: The code from Pack.cpp is provided directly below:. . . // Project UID 1d9f47bfc76643019cfbf037641defe1.  #include "Card.h".  #include "Pack.h".  #include <cassert>. #include <array>. #include <string>.  // EFFECTS: Initializes the Pack to be in the following standard order:.   //          the cards of the lowest suit arranged from lowest rank to.   //          highest rank, followed by the cards of the next lowest suit.   //          in order from lowest to highest rank, and so on..   // NOTE: The standard order is the same as that in pack.in..   // NOTE: Do NOT use pack.in in your implementation of this function.  Pack::Pack(){.     int k = 0; .     for (int i = 0; i < NUM_SUITS; ++i).     {.         for (int j = 7; i < NUM_RANKS; ++j).         { .             cards[k] = Card(RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[j], SUIT_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[i]);.             k = k + 1; .         }.     }.     next = 0;.  }. .   // REQUIRES: pack_input contains a representation of a Pack in the.   //           format required by the project specification.   // MODIFIES: pack_input.   // EFFECTS: Initializes Pack by reading from pack_input..   Pack::Pack(std::istream& pack_input){.     std::string junk;.     std::string r;.     std::string s;.     for(int i=0; i<PACK_SIZE; ++i){.       pack_input >> r >> junk >> s;.       cards[i] = Card(r, s);.     }.     next = 0;.   }.  .   // REQUIRES: cards remain in the Pack.   // EFFECTS: Returns the next card in the pack and increments the next index.    Card Pack::deal_one(){.      int old_next = next;.      next = next + 1;.      return cards[old_next];.    }. .   // EFFECTS: Resets next index to first card in the Pack.   void Pack::reset(){.     next = 0; .   }. .   // EFFECTS: Shuffles the Pack and resets the next index. This.   //          performs an in shuffle seven times. See.   //          https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/In_shuffle..   void Pack::shuffle(){.     for(int i = 0; i < 7; ++i){.       std::array<Card, (PACK_SIZE/2)> temp_array_1;.       std::array<Card, (PACK_SIZE/2)> temp_array_2;.       for(int j = 0; j<(PACK_SIZE/2); ++j){.         temp_array_1[j] = cards[j];.       }.       for(int k = (PACK_SIZE/2); k<PACK_SIZE; ++k){.         temp_array_2[k] = cards[k];.       }.       for(int a = 1; a<PACK_SIZE; a+=2){.         int b = (a-1)/2; .         cards[a-1] = temp_array_2[b];.         cards[a] = temp_array_1[b];.         .       }.     }.   }. .   // EFFECTS: returns true if there are no more cards left in the pack.   bool Pack:: empty() const{.     if(next == PACK_SIZE){.       return true;.        }.     else{.       return false; .     }.   }. .
i_answer: You use i in your 2nd for-loop condition in Pack::Pack()-- use j instead (ex. j < NUM_RANKS instead of i < NUM_RANKS).

subject: Human discard Player.cpp
content: "The user will then enter the number corresponding to the card they want to discard". . For this part of the function will the human do this knowing zero-indexed or do we need to account for the number not being zero indexed?
i_answer: When you print the cards for the human out, they will have their index with them. See Appendix B of the spec. . Because of this, I assume the human will enter the index so you do not have to worry about changing their input to resent the index .

subject: Error with sorting vector of cards and operators
content: . . . . . /usr/include/c++/8/bits/stl_algobase.h:548:18: error: passing ‘const Card’ as ‘this’ argument discards qualifiers [-fpermissive].       *--__result = std::move(*--__last);. . . . . . . . . . Does anyone know what this error means? I'm pretty sure it is related to using std::sort to sort a vector of cards, and the operators I implemented in Card.cpp
i_answer: You're using the sort function in a const function, which is not allowed. For example, if you called the sort function in make_trump, you'll get this error because make_trump is defined as const and you called sort in there. Whenever you call sort(), make sure it is always in a non const function

subject: How do we even know if a pack is empty other than with the "next" variable?
content: I don't know if this is a dumb question or not, but I have been struggling to find out how my implementation of the empty function in pack is wrong. I have essentially been checking to see if next is greater or equal to 23 but I am not sure how to do it other than that.
i_answer: That seems good to me, if to works then it is good

subject: Add and Discard Function
content: In the add and discard function, the player adds the card then discards the card. However, in the implementation, should the player physically have the card (as it says in modifies clause of the function that a card is added to the hand and then discarded). The only problem is that, wouldn't this violate the required clause of add_card(), as you would be trying to add a card to a hand of 5 (which is the MAX_HAND_SIZE).
i_answer: If the player adds and discards, then they have to either 1) remove a different card from their hand, or 2) discard the current card in order to keep a hand of size 5.

And another question: for functions like make_trump and add_and_discard  of human player do we print the player's hand in the function or in like euchre.cpp?. . Thanks!
i_answer: You just prompt the human player for an integer for add and discard. You can print out the hand in euchre.cpp

subject: Error in Player_tests.cpp where it does not allow call to Pack functions
content: Hello!. I was trying to call deal_one in player to distribute cards to players. But in all the places where I called the function, it gave this error:. . I have included Pack.h in the file as well as Card.h. I also tried commenting out the Player tests and copying the Pack public tests in the file and running the Pack_public_test from Player_Tests. It gave me the same error. However, when I run the pack public test in its own file, it compiles and runs:.
i_answer: make Player_tests.exe and make Player_public_test.exe don't include Pack.cpp as a build dependency as you can see in the "g++" line in your first picture. I'd try writing your Player tests to match the format of those in the Player public test (as in neither requiring Pack functions). You can think of Pack and Player as 2 separate modules that are both important to the final game, but don't necessarily (and probably) shouldn't need to know about each other.

subject: return of card lead_card in player.cpp
content: Hi,. For card lead_card, I am not sure what the function is suppose to return. After deleting the card from the player's deck of card, is there another step we are suppose to do?
i_answer: You are supposed to return the Card that the player leads with. For example, if a player leads with a 10 of hearts, then you must delete the 10 of hearts from the player hand then return the 10 of hearts

subject: add_card Player.cpp
content: How can I check if a player has less than the MAX_HAND_SIZE cards? Is there a helper function we implemented before that we can use or do we need to make our own
i_answer: If your hand is a vector, you can call .size() on the hand

subject: error checking for strings
content: for euchre.cpp, when I error-check the various command-line arguments, I want to check whether certain arguments are equal to a certain string (for example, display an error message if argv[2] != "shuffle". when I do this though, I'm getting an error that says "result of comparison against a string literal is unspecified (use an explicit string comparison function instead)". . . How do I compare whether a command-line argument is equal to a certain string?
i_answer: Right now you are trying to compare 2 objects that are not the same type. We can remedy this in 2 ways.. . Convert your lhs to a C++ string and use the != operator as you are doing. or. Convert your right to a C-String and use the strcmp function .

subject: Player_Factory Error: "Object of abstract class...."
content: Hi,. . In my player_factory function I keep getting an error when trying to return new HumanPlayer(name) and new SimplePlayer(name). I saw another post with my exact same error and while it should be expected for SimplePlayer because I have not implemented/functioned stubbed that class yet, I have implemented part of HumanPlayer and function stubbed the functions I haven't implemented yet. Any help is appreciated and I'll attach a picture below..
i_answer: Make sure that the function headers are the same for the pure virtual Player.h functions and the functions youi implement in the derived class. Your error message says that get_name() has no overrider--make sure you haven't forgotten the const keyword.

subject: BAD_ACCESS_ERROR in Pack.cpp deal_one
content: . What is wrong with the code? Not sure why the error seems to imply its going out of bounds?
i_answer: Say `PACK_SIZE` is 24, and `next` is 23 entering the function. Keeping in mind that arrays are indexed from 0, this function will increment `next` to be 24 and then attempt to retrieve the `next`th element of `cards`, which is the 24th element. However, there are only 23 elements in `cards` because we start at 0.

So if they are different suits, wouldn't this function also have to check is_trump in order to be sure one outranks the other?

subject: Marches and euchres
content: To make sure I understand:. . A march occurs when a team wins 5 tricks, and they receive two points.. A euchre occurs when the team which ordered up loses and the opposing team receives two points.. . Is that correct, and can a march and euchre occur (ie the team that orders up loses and the opposing team wins all 5 tricks) and if they both do does the opposing team receive 4 points?
i_answer: in some variations of euchre, yes, but in the one in the spec, no. It says that it’s only considered a march if the winning team orders up and wins all 5 tricks

subject: Simple Player Playing Tricks
content: Hi,. . I was comparing my euchre results to the results of euchre_test_01.out.correct while debugging, and I wasn't sure why the correct test results were printing out results the way they did, for Hand 1.. . Here is my thought process:. . 1. For Hand 1, Edsger orders up Diamonds, which means that the trump suit must be Diamonds.. . 2. For the 4th trick, Jack of Hearts is led by Edsger. This means that the led suit of the 4th trick must be Hearts.. . 3. In sum, for the 4th trick of the 1st hand, the trump suit is Diamonds and the led suit is Hearts. . . 4. We know by looking at the results printed in the 4th and 5th trick that at the start of the 4th trick Fran has two cards: Nine of Diamonds, and Ten of Spades. . . 5. At this point, Fran does not have any cards that follow the suit of the lead suit (hearts).. . 6. Therefore, as a simple player, Fran must play the lowest card in their hand.. . 7. The lowest card out of the two Fran has is Ten of Spades. The suit of Nine of Diamonds is equal to the suit of the trump suit, so it must be higher than the card that is not a trump suit.. . 8. Since the lowest card is the Ten of Spades, Fran must play Ten of Spades.. . My code follows my thought process explained above, but the correct test results are different. I was wondering if there was a flaw in my logic.. . Thank you in advance!. . (FYI, the left side is the correct results, and the right side is the results for my code).
i_answer: In your Step 2, because the Trump suit is Diamonds the Jack of Hearts (left bower) is also considered a diamond. Thus, the led suit is Diamonds and the trump suit is Diamonds. That is why Fran plays the Nine of Diamonds; she is following suit.

subject: player.cpp
content: I'm a bit confused what we're supposed to do for player.cpp. Do we define the functions from player.h in player.cpp? And if we do, when I copy and paste any given function, to player.cpp it tells me member function may not be redeclared outside its class.. Also, do we remove the 0s from player.h?
i_answer: You'll have to implement the functions definitions that are listed in Player.h. The 0s indicate that the function is pure virtual, meaning that you must provide an implementation for the function in all derived classes. Note that you cannot instantiate a Player directly because it has pure virtual functions. Since you have two types of players--Simple and Human--you'll need to create two derived classes from Player and fill in their implementation according to the spec.. . The 0s can be removed when you implement the functions. Keeping them in will make the classes you make abstract!

subject: Add_and_Discard
content: The spec says about add_and_discard: "If the trump suit is ordered up during round one, the dealer picks up the upcard. The dealer then discards the lowest card in their hand, even if this is the upcard, for a final total of five cards. (Note that at this point, the trump suit is the suit of the upcard." But what about the second round, how does the dealer know what the trump suit is to make a decision? And when deciding what card to discard, I compare the cards considering the trump suit right?
i_answer: If it is round two then the upcard will have been “flipped over” and there is no longer a card for the dealer to pick up, and therefore no longer a decision to be made by the dealer. So, the dealer would only have to choose a card to discard if it was round 1. . . Also, during the second round of making trump, Simple players consider ordering up the suit with the same color as the upcard. Per the spec, 'screw the dealer' requires that the dealer always order up this suit in Round 2 if they are a Simple player.

subject: Why do we need dynamic memory for Player_factory?
content: Normally, when a function return, even though its activation record get deleted, the returning value will still be returned to the place that call it. For example, in the function. . int sum(int x, int y){.   int z = x + y;.   return z;. }. we don't need to declare z with the "new" keyword since the value of z will be returned to the place that call the function.. . So why can't we use the same approach for Player_factory? Why can't we declare it as a function that return a Player, and then in the function we create the Player and return the Player itself, not the pointer that points to it?
i_answer: The student answer is correct. You cannot create an object of type Player--it is an abstract class (actually an interface, since all of its member functions are pure virtual), so there is no such thing as a "Player" object. You can only instantiate derived classes of Player, like Human and Simple, which can be pointer to by a player Pointer.

subject: Confusion about make trump
content: I read the following in the spec: "A Simple Player does not consider whether they are the dealer and could gain an additional trump by picking up the upcard.) If that is the case, then why do we need the parameter "is_dealer"? Do we take into consideration if the simple player is a dealer or not in make_trump? I am kind of confused.
i_answer: While you are correct in that being the dealer has no effect on the player during round one of making trump, if round two reaches the dealer we invoke screw the dealer which means they must make trump. So, you really only need to check if the player is the dealer during round two of making trump.

subject: No member named push_back
content: I figure using the push_back function would be useful for add_card in player but I get an error that says push_back is not in the std::array<Card, 5>
i_answer: push_back() is not a member function of std::array, but it is a member function of std::vector.  Perhaps making your std::array object an std::vector sounds better suited for you, since it sounds like you want to be able to have access to a push_back function

subject: Comparing ranks
content: Would something like lhs.get_rank() < rhs.get_rank() work to compare the ranks of two cards. I don't understand why it's not working when I test it.
i_answer: the get_rank() member function returns a string, so if you try doing lhs.get_rank() < rhs.get_rank(), this would attempt to do string comparison, which means that lhs.get_rank() < rhs.get_rank() will return true if lhs' rank is lexographically less than rhs' rank.. . I recommend using rank_names_by_weight when trying to compare the ranks of two cards.

subject: add_and_discard
content: The spec says: "If the trump suit is ordered up during round one, the dealer picks up the upcard. The dealer then discards the lowest card in their hand, even if this is the upcard, for a final total of five cards.". . I figured it would make sense to use the add_and_discard(const Card &upcard) function for this. However, it is possible that the upcard could be removed from the hand in this function, so my compiler says this breaks the rule of upcard being const. Should I be making a copy of upcard in my function and adding that copy to my hand?
i_answer: The error stems from your make_trump implementation.  make_trump is a const function which means you cannot modify any of the member variables of the player object in that function, yet you call add_and_discard within make_trump and add_and_discard modifies one of your Player's member variables.  I would avoid calling add_and_discard in your make_trump function, and just focus on determining whether your player just wants to make trump.

subject: Shuffle Procedure
content: Is there a public video available that shows the shuffling procedure
i_answer: I have not come across a good video, but here is an explanation that made sense to me.. . . Lay out all the cards in a deck in a line. Split this deck down the middle. We will call this LHS and RHS. Your output card pile is currently empty. The LHS and RHS each are their own pile and you can consider them to have their own indexes. To build your output card pile, add the first card in the RHS, and then the first card in the LHS (index 0). Now there are two cards in your output. Then add the next card in the RHS and then the next card in the LHS (index 1). Now there are 4 cards in your output. Repeat this process until all the cards are in your output pile. This is considered to be 1 in-shuffle.. . . Keep in mind this is a very manual/ brute way of doing the in-shuffle. Think about shortcuts you can make when implementing the algorithm.

subject: Initializing Next() in Pack
content: In the Pack class, I understand that the next variable refers to the index of the next card to be dealt, but when looking at the array of cards, is it the card on the bottom of the array or on the top (i.e. is it index 0 and index 23)? Also, should this be initialized to 0 in both constructors?
i_answer: The way which you shuffle could lead you to having the 'next' variable to start at 23 and decrease, or start at 0 and increase. One way will be more complex than the other because a non-shuffled deck will be in increasing order (2 -> 3-> .... Ace). I will leave the second question up to you to think about.

subject: std::sort sometimes sorts in reverse order
content: Card b(Card::RANK_TWO, Card::SUIT_SPADES);    Card c(Card::RANK_THREE, Card::SUIT_SPADES);    ASSERT_TRUE(b < c);    ASSERT_TRUE(c > b);    std::vector<Card> cards;    cards.push_back(b);    cards.push_back(c);    std::sort(cards.begin(),cards.end());. . cards[0] outputs to be 3 of spades and cards[1] outputs to be 2 of spades, even though both assert statements pass. How is this even possible?
i_answer: fixed, there was an error in my < function and the two assert statements weren't comprehensive enough to catch it

subject: Question about index in loop
content: For example: . . for(int i=0;i<SOME_NUM;i++). {. //line1: do something 1. //line2: do something 2. }. . I am confused about when will i update in the loop? Will i update after finish compiled ALL the lines in the loop or it updates after compiled the line 1?. . I am asking this since when I test the code in function lead_card, I notice I set the maximum card as hand[i], but it turns out giving me hand[i-1] rather than i.
i_answer: a for loop operates by executing the first statement once at the beginning. Then, it evaluates the second expression, and if it’s true, it executes the body of the loop. Then it executes the third expression (incrementing `i`). Then, it checks the second (conditional) statement, executes the loop if true, and so on. it’s equivalent to a while loop like this:int i = 0;while (i < SOME_NUM) {    // do something     i++;}

subject: Deleting Card Object in Card_tests.cpp while Writing Test Cases
content: Do we have to delete the Card object every time we declare a Card object for each test case? I remember we had to delete Matrix objects back in project 2, so I'm not sure if it applies here.
i_answer: No. The reason we needed to delete Matrix objects in P2 is because we created the Matrix objects with the "new" keyword. In other words, every object that is created with "new" must later be removed with "delete".. . Card doesn't need to be allocated with "new", so it doesn't need "delete".. . Though if you are wondering why Matrix and Card are treated differently, the class will be covering this topic (dynamic memory) later in the semester.

subject: Card.cpp compile error: unused variables
content: Hi, I'm getting a compile error when making Card_tests that I'm not sure how to fix. We are calling lhsSuitIndex and rhsSuitIndex later in the function, but inside if statements, so I was thinking that could be the issue. However, we're using very similar structures in other operator functions in Card.cpp without a problem, and this is the only error that shows up for the entire file.. .
i_answer: I can't give you a definitive answer without seeing the code, but what this error is indicating is that. You declare these variablesYou initialize these variablesBUT you don't use them. So make sure you can find the place where you actually use the values, instead of just assigning values to them.. . Though if you still can't find the issue, you'd be welcome to create a private private post with your code so the staff can take a closer look

subject: Operator Functions
content: . I was reading through some of the comments on Piazza and saw someone already asked something similar to this, but do we need to do a for loop to take in account the suit or rank?  Or in general do we need to check for that? Based off the spec I was a little confused if we were supposed to just follow the spec or if it was more complicated than that.
i_answer: I won't tell you exactly how to do it, but you will need to take into account the suit and rank in this function. The suit and rank is what makes a card unique, so it will need to be used to tell if two cards are equal.. . Just using the == operator here will not work. Here's why:. . When someone uses "==" on two card objects, the operator== function is what gets called. Because your operator== function uses "==", this is equivalent to saying the function is calling itself. (So it won't work as you intend). Explicitly comparing the suit and rank would be the better approach.

If anyone has any insight or guidance I would greatly appreciate it!

subject: Defining our own stuff
content: Can we define our own structs and our own operators when implementing things? I'm finding operator bool potentially useful. Thank you!
i_answer: You are allowed to do custom structs and functions. However, you cannot change any of the interfaces (or header files).. . For example, you would be allowed to implement and use a helper function within Card.cpp, but you wouldn't be able to add that function to Card.h

subject: Should we use assert() for representation invariants for card?
content: I'm wondering if its necessary to assert() for whether or not the inputted rank or suit is a valid rank (ie, "Two", "Three"(...),"Queen", "King") or suit ("Spades", "Clubs", etc), or not since its in the REQUIRES clause? Should we test having invalid inputs to card()?
i_answer: It is generally good practice to use assert() on the conditions described in the REQUIRES clause.

subject: Operator == Clarification
content: Quick question,. . . . When the effects says that it returns true if lhs == rhs, are we saying that the lhs card is exactly equal to the rhs? or is it saying that the cards are of the same rank since there are 4 cards of different suit, but the same rank.. . thanks.
i_answer: It's saying that it returns true if it is exactly equal. Remember, if the cards are of the same rank, we break ties by using the suit.

subject: Question about is_face()
content: I just run my own card_tests.exe again, and I always failed the test for Card_less trump one. In the test case, I set card a "Nine of Spades", card b "Jack of Spades" thus the function should be true but it always gives false, i.e. Nine is bigger than Jack, which is not correct.. . I looked back in my operator < function, it seems like I did not consider the face card situation.. . So is it that true that the comparison of number cards and face cards should be separated? I thought we could regard Jack as 11 and Queen as 12, etc. I did not find a relative explanation in spec, did I miss something?
i_answer: Look at the RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[] and SUIT_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[] arrays in card.h. Maybe you can use these to your advantage when comparing cards (when not taking trump into account)

subject: Trump suit meaning in card_less function
content: Hi,. . In the value of cards section of the spec, what does it mean by "if a trump suit is present"? Specifically, in the card_less function, does that mean a trump suit is present if a or b are of the trump suit?. . Thanks!
i_answer: In the value of cards section of the spec, "if a trump suit is present" means that if one of the cards is the trump suit, the value of the cards will not be the same as the most simple case.. . In the card_less function, yes that is referring to if a or b are of the trump suit.

subject: Understanding errors?
content: When trying to make Card_tests.exe, my terminal yells at me for a lot of errors that are all within the card operator functions-- they look like this:. . . . OH recommended that I make a couple helper functions to determine the rank of the card's rank/suit. They are:. . . int get_suit_rank(std::string& suit){.     for (int i = 0; i < NUM_SUITS; ++i) {.         if (SUIT_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[i] == suit) {.             return i;.         }.     }. . }. . int get_rank_rank(std::string& rank) {.     for (int i = 0; i < NUM_RANKS; ++i){.         if (RANK_NAMES_BY_WEIGHT[i] == rank) {.             return i;.         }.     }.     . }. And my operator implementations are all similar to each other, so here's one of them:. . . bool operator<(const Card& lhs, const Card& rhs) {.     int l_suit_rank = get_suit_rank(lhs.get_suit());.     int l_rank_rank = get_rank_rank(lhs.get_rank());. .     int r_suit_rank = get_suit_rank(rhs.get_suit());.     int r_rank_rank = get_rank_rank(rhs.get_rank());. . .     if (r_rank_rank > l_rank_rank) {.         if (r_suit_rank > l_suit_rank) {.             return true;.         }.         else {.             return false;.         }.     }.     else {.         return false;.     }. . }. I really don't understand the errors I'm getting-- they only show up when I try to make it through the terminal, Visual Studio seems happy.. . . There's also these two, which I understand logically, but I'm not sure how my code does this.Sorry that this is such a chunky post! My partner is... at a gaming tournament this weekend, so I'm not able to ask him for help.
i_answer: Your helpers should take in those strings by reference-to-const, not a normal reference. i.e., it should be. . . . int get_suit_rank(const std::string& suit). . The same applies to your get_rank_rank function. Also, for those last few errors that say "control reaches end of non-void function", just make sure you always return something in those helper functions. So, after your loop just return some int (it doesn't matter what that int is, since ideally your code will never get to that point. ). C++ doesn't like it when there's a possibility that your code doesn't return something when it said that it would. . . . Explanation for the reference-to-const thing (optional, you don't need to understand this to fix your problem) : C++ has concepts called "rvalues" and "lvalues". You can think of rvalues as temporary values and lvalues as values that occupy a semi-permanent place in memory. The get_rank() function you're calling returns an rvalue--it's temporary. If you don't save that value in a variable, it'll just be gone. C++ doesn't like taking in rvalues by reference (that would imply that you could change these rvalues, which doesn't necessarily make sense since they're temporary.) However, you can take them in by reference-to-const. The explanation is more complicated than this, but I don't personally know all the details.

subject: Human or Simple Helper Functions
content: How are we supposed to write helper functions specific to Human or Simple, if we cannot declare our helpers until after the class definition, and our class member functions use such helpers?. . If you try to define the classes first, and then declare the member functions using "::" after the helpers, you get a make style duplicate error because the Human and Simple players have almost identical class specifications without implementation?. . Are we not supposed to pass in Child class specific reference variables to our helpers? And just pass related member variables?. i.e void my_func(vector<Card> &h){} instead of void my_func(SimplePlayer &p){};
i_answer: If you're writing helper functions, they should be static. Yes, you'd want to pass in related member variables--if you just pass in a reference to the specific class, you wouldn't be able to access any of the relevant member variables anyway (they're private).

subject: human tests
content: how do we test human functions that require input from cin?
i_answer: To clarify: you are not required to submit tests for the human player, and Player_test.cpp should not include tests for human players.. . Though if you still want to write some tests for human players, you can utilize input redirection (which we introduced in P1, and what we can use for testing euchre.exe with human players). . For example, you could run "human_tests.exe < input.in". Where human_tests.exe is an executable compiled from human test cases, and input.in describes the decisions that a human could make.

subject: euchre_Test01.out.correct Simple play_card strategy question
content: Hi, I have a question about the Simple player’s play_card strategy and why the euchre_test01.out.correct file plays a specific card.. . My program successfully outputs matching plays up to this point:. . . ./euchre.exe pack.in shuffle 10 Edsger Simple Fran Simple Gabriel Simple Herb Simple . Hand 0. Edsger deals. Nine of Hearts turned up. Fran orders up Hearts. . King of Clubs led by Fran. Ace of Clubs played by Gabriel. Ten of Clubs played by Herb. Jack of Clubs played by Edsger. Gabriel takes the trick. . King of Spades led by Gabriel. Ten of Spades played by Herb. Ace of Spades played by Edsger. Queen of Spades played by Fran. Edsger takes the trick. . King of Diamonds led by Edsger. Nine of Spades played by Fran. At this point, it is Gabriel’s turn. Gabriel hasNine of Clubs, Queen of Hearts, and Jack of Diamonds remaining in his hand. This can be verified by seeing what other cards Gabriel eventually plays during the hand in euchre_test01.out.correct:. . . L21: Nine of Clubs played by Gabriel. L27: Queen of Hearts played by Gabriel. L32: Jack of Diamonds played by Gabriel. Spec: “If a Simple Player can follow suit, they play the highest card that follows suit.”Led card: King of Diamonds by Edsger, L19Trump: Hearts by Fran, L5Gabrial has [Nine of Clubs, Queen of Hearts, Jack of Diamonds]. From the spec, Gabriel must follow the suit of the led card, Diamonds, by playing Jack of Diamonds. Why does he instead play Nine of Clubs according to euchre_test01.out.correct?. . Here is my state within play_card, if that helps.. . . . Edit: I also just submitted by code to the Autograder if someone needs to look at it.

I run the public test and all my cards elements are two of spades.  Thanks.
i_answer: You need to individually initialize each card to the correct value and suit. All the cards in your pack are two of spades because that's the behaviour of Card's default constructor.

subject: Question about make_trump
content: For this function:. . //EFFECTS If Player wishes to order up a trump suit then return true and. //  change order_up_suit to desired suit.  If Player wishes to pass, then do. //  not modify order_up_suit and return false.. virtual bool simple::make_trump(const Card &upcard, bool is_dealer,int round,.                                 std::string &order_up_suit). . what does is_dealer do here? And through which parameter we could know the player wants to order up or we know it through main?.
i_answer: make_trump should be implementing the (human or simple) player strategy for the making trump portion of play. Who the dealer is can be relevant to the strategy used, so is_dealer should be true when make_trump is called on the dealer and false otherwise. Given your knowledge of when players decide to order up or not, this function will be indicating that decision for the player it is called on. Essentially, you will call this function from your driver when your players are deciding the upcard, passing in the appropriate parameters.

subject: Question about Player.cpp

subject: Card Less Bowers
content: In the card_less function in Card.cpp, do we need to consider left and right bowers? For example, if you pass in the ace of the trump suit and the left bower, should the left bower be considered higher or the ace?
i_answer: The left bower would be considered higher than the ace of the trump suit

i_answer: Most likely you're trying to do a os << endl; in the operator<< implementation.  Make sure you're not including any whitespace besides the space before "of" and the space after "of"

subject: Card Ranks
content: Both the suit and the number of the card determines the rank. Are the ranks first dependent on the suit and then the number? So if I were to have a 3 of Diamonds and a king of Spades, the 3 of Diamonds would be higher rank? Thanks
i_answer: The rank is solely dependent on the number or letter on the card. The value of the card goes by rank first then suit to break ties. So King of Spades is higher than 3 of Diamonds. 3 of Diamonds is also higher than 3 of Spades.

subject: Confused by suit next
content: //REQUIRES suit is a valid suit//EFFECTS returns the next suit, which is the suit of the same colorstd::string Suit_next(const std::string &suit);. . Im confused as to what this function does.. . this is the code already provided in the header file btw.
i_answer: This function takes in an input described as a suite. What the implementation should do is find what the other suite of the same color is and return it. So if the suite were diamonds, you would want to return hearts.

subject: What is a Pack
content: Not sure if this is a stupid question or not but I didn't notice anywhere was a pack of cards is. I was wondering are we supposed to make an array of cards that is our pack?
i_answer: Not a stupid question at all! A pack of cards is the cards used to play the game, you can think about it as the box of playing cards you would buy at the store. If you look at Pack.h, there is this member variable: std::array cards;. Does this answer your question?

subject: Can we add other functions in cpp file outside of the .h files

i_answer: According to the spec:. . . Write helper functions in Card.cpp and Pack.cpp as non-member functions in the .cpp files and declare them static. .

However, we cannot verify that everything in this function is correct because we want you to get used to writing test cases for your functions and checking yourself to see if you caught everything. subject: When to use Card::
content: In Card.cpp, when do we need to put Card:: in front of the rank and suit names and when do we not? I'm confused about the difference between using it and not using it.
i_answer: If you're inside a function that has `Card::` in front of the function name, then you don't need it for rank and suit names. From anywhere else you do. Also, if it's less confusing, you can just always include it

subject: operator<
content: . when testing the "<", card a should have a smaller value than card b because of their suits. And get_suit returns the correct value. when I comparing the Card::SUIT_SPADES and Card::SUIT_HEARTS or "Spades" and "Hearts", the operator work as expected. But the lhs.get_suit() and rhs.get_suit() is not expect.
i_answer: You should not use the < operator to compare Card::SUIT_SPADES and Card::SUIT_HEARTS, or to compare the suits of the cards in the operator< function. You should use the ordering provided in this part of the spec: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cards

subject: Question about destructors
content: Hi. . I notice that all the classes in project 3, except player, have no destructors, like ~ Card(); I am curious about the reason? It is okay to not have destructors?
i_answer: the compiler will put in a default destructor for you, so you don't need to define it unless you want to do some specific cleanup or your dtor has to be virtual (i.e. you're inheriting from the class)

content: Hi. . I just downloaded the starter file, modified my cpp file as instructed in the spec, and I seen these flags in both my card.h and card.cpp file for the declared rank and suit in the card class. The"constexpr const" was flagged with the error of "explicit type is missing ('int' assumed)" in the .h file and "this declaration has no storage class or type specifier" in the cpp file. I was wondering how could I fix this problem. I am pretty sure I have not modified anything besides copying and pasting the functions into the cpp file. . . Thank you!.
i_answer: @1500. . To get to the settings press ctrl+shift+p or cmd+shift+p (depends if you are on windows or mac) and click edit c++ configurations (UI or json works)

subject: Comparing Instances of Classes
content: I'm confused on how to compare the rank and the suite at the same time for the overloaded operators functions. Can someone please help me?
i_answer: i don’t know what you mean by “at the same time,” but the idea is that you compare the rank and then if the ranks are tied you use suit to break the tie

subject: Second member value in pack
content: I am not sure what the second member value in pack represents "std::array<Card, PACK_SIZE> cards", is it an array of vectors?
i_answer: std::array requires you to specify the size at compile time, so that’s saying it’s an array of length PACK_SIZE (or 24)

i_answer: Marking as resolved

subject: Stack Overflow
content: My partner and I wrote our code for Card.cpp and Pack.cpp and wanted to see what autograder said about it. We are getting a stack overflow thread #1 error in our Card set function. We are confused what we are doing wrong with this function, it seems to be an easier one to write. I added screenshots below, but my uniquename is mackiewi if you want to check it out on autograder. Any help will be greatly appreciated.. .
i_answer: Recall that a stack frame is created every time you make a function call, and that programs have a limited amount of space to hold all of these stack frames. When the number of these stack frames exceeds this size limit, you get a stack overflow error - this will usually happen if you write a program that makes too many continually nesting function calls. A situation where this will definitely happen is a function that recursively calls itself with no base case/end condition - it will infinitely nest, creating stack frame until its used up all the stack space and causes a stack overflow error.. . You should think about if this is the case here, if you're infinitely recursing. Here's a hint: inside this Card constructor you're implementing, you're constructing another card called set - what constructor is this going to call? Should you be constructing another card inside the Card constructor?

subject: How many derived classes are we supposed to write in player.cpp?
content: Are we supposed to write only two derived player class - Player Human and Player Simple(robot)??. Thx for help.
i_answer: Yes, you will be creating 2 derived classes - one each for the simple and human player.

subject: Confusion about operator functions in Card.cpp
content: When implementing operator functions in Card.cpp, do we need to change the string type of "rank" into interger type, or we can just compare they like those in the Appendix D in the project spec? Thank you for clarification!
i_answer: You shouldn't change them into int since in the later functions, the parameters' type will be strings, so you can just use RANK_JACK, etc. and regards them as integer

subject: Card equality
content: For the <= and == operators in card.cpp how is it that two cards can be equal to one another
i_answer: Two cards can be equal if they have the same rank and suit. Because all the cards in euchre are unique, this will never be the case, but we are making a general card class.

subject: Question about pack.cpp
content: Hi . . I am inserting pack.cpp now, and there is a function's comment:. . // REQUIRES: cards remain in the Pack. . What does that mean? Should array cards always be in the Pack?
i_answer: It means that once your Pack is constructed, you don't take out the individual Card objects from the pack (i don't think that's even a thing you can do in the std::array interface so you'd have to figure out some contrived way to do it). You use the same 24 constructed objects and just copy them or move them around and if you need to indicate that a card has been dealt you use the `next` member variable

subject: Operator < Help
content: Are these function implementations correct? Or are we supposed also compare the Card's suit and rank as well
i_answer: When someone uses "<" on two card objects, the operator< function is what gets called. Because your operator< function uses "<", this is equivalent to saying the function is calling itself. (So it won't work as you intend). . Explicitly comparing the suit and rank would be the better approach.

subject: comparison operator inclusion
content: For all of the comparison operators, should we just be considering the rank of the cards, or the suits too? I'm inclined to think we would consider just rank, but I want to confirm.
i_answer: You should consider both the rank and suit of the cards. Remember that cards are ordered by rank and ties are broken by suit.

subject: Testing add_and_discard function
content: Are we supposed to use assert to check the add_and_discard function in any way? Right now, I am using this function and then testing playing or leading a card because add_and_discard is void but I am missing a few points on my Player tests and am trying to figure out why. Sometimes playing or leading cards is dependent on what goes on in add_and_discard which is why I have been testing it that way. Thanks!
i_answer: You can't directly test add_and_discard directly. What you can do is call add_and_discard on a hand, then call lead card or play card repeatedly until the hand is empty to check if the correct card was swapped out and that you are playing cards in the correct order. If you are already doing this, try with this with edge cases in both the upcard as well as trump (ex: left bower, mix of trump, all trump, etc)

subject: Do we have to add a test for something already in the public test?
content: I noticed Card_public_test.cpp already had tests for is_face(), printing, and next_suit(). Do we also have to write our own tests for these?
i_answer: Yes. The public tests are helpful on a basic level but for the sake of testing your own functions and getting graded on the effectiveness of your tests, it's recommended u make comprehensive tests for each function.

subject: Card Rank/Suit names
content: Hi,This might be a silly question but I’m a little confused on how to interact with these initialized variables!. I'm a bit lost on how to move back and forth between each of them (from SUIT_SPADES to "Spades", etc) especially when trying to use them with the ranked arrays to determine which one is higher than another. I see there's a pointer symbol in there but I'm not really sure what to do with that. Any help would be appreciated!
i_answer: SUIT_SPADES is an alias for "Spades", so you can treat it as a normal variable with value "Spades." As far as using them with the ranked arrays, think about the index of the suit in the array and how you can use that to determine if one suit is higher than another.

subject: card less
content: in the card less functions, do I need to compare cards who are neither trump nor leads? I thought not because if a card was not of a trump or lead suit it could not be the strongest card in any situation.
i_answer: Card_less() can have input cards "a" and "b" that are neither trump nor lead cards. So you still need to account for this situation.

subject: Does left bower still have the old suit?
content: The left bower is considered as a trump, but does it still have the old suit?. For example, if the led suit is heart, while the trump suit is diamond, does playing the jack of heart (the left bower) counts as ""follow suit"?
i_answer: I've got to disagree with the Instructor answer here. From the spec, "if Diamonds is trump, the Jack of Hearts is also considered a Diamond, not a Heart". To me, this sounds like the left bower is considered to be of the trump suit. In the case of a hearts-led trick, playing a Diamond would not be considered following suit.

subject: Meaning of order up
content: What's the meaning of order up?
i_answer: select the suit of the upcard to be the trump suit

subject: operators and priniting classes

i_answer: You're not explicitly calling any functions, as "==" is just an equal-to operator.. . However, since you defined an overloaded operation==() function, when comparing Things using "==", the compiler will run that overloaded function instead of the default one.

subject: What deck is used for hands other than the first hand?
content: For the Euchre game in Project 3, for the first hand (hand 0) the program will read in a pack of cards and then shuffle that deck and then the dealer deal the cards.. For hands other than the first hand, what deck do we start with? Do we start with the original read-in deck and do the shuffle again? If we do so, the cards in every hand will be the same (because we start with the same deck and use the same shuffle algorithm and the same dealing algorithm) Or is there a way to determine the starting ordering of cards for hand 1 bases on game activities in hand 0?
i_answer: student answer is correct! see this part of the spec: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#shuffle

subject: How to determine led suit?
content: Hi,. . after I read the instruction, I know what the right and left bower are but how do we determine what led suit is? Like in this picture:. . why the led suit is diamonds not hearts or something else? How do we determine that?
i_answer: led suit is the suit the leader of a trick started with. for example, for the first trick(round), the person left of the dealer starts. they will be able to pick any card in their hand to start the round. if they put down an ace of diamonds (or any other diamonds) that means diamonds is led. If they lead with a clubs card then clubs has been led. so on and so forth.. . in this specific example from the instructions, someone had started the trick with diamonds, so the led suit is diamonds. . . https://playingcarddecks.com/blogs/how-to-play/euchre-game-rules. I found this link that has a video description that was a lot easier for me to digest in case you think it would be useful.

subject: Get_suit functions
content: For these get_suit functions, how can I make sure that one considers the trump suit and the other doesn't?. Also, is the trump suit supposed to include the Right and Left Bower for the second get_suit function?. .
i_answer: Depending on how you call that function is what function gets called. So if u call with no parameters then the first one gets called, if you give it the trump suit then the 2nd one gets called.  Use that reasoning to figure out how to consider to use/not use trump suit. The hint just says the Left bower, so id just stick with that card.

i_answer: I figured it out myself. It should be something like this: Card class has a card's rank and suit, trump is the current turn's trump, so we are comparing trump+jack with that card

subject: Player class
content: I am at the point that I am trying to implement the player class through player.cpp, however now that I am here I have noticed that player.h does not have any member data or constructors. I believe that this has something to do with the derived classes that we are supposed to write. Do I write those in player.cpp?. . My apologies for all the questions, now that I am at this part of the spec I am not too sure how to proceed.
i_answer: Yes.  You write your derived classes' implementations in Player.cpp. . Yes you remove the "= 0".  Removing the "virtual" keyword in your derived class implementations is optional.. (From the lecture notes: The virtual keyword is necessary in the base class, but optional in the derived classes.)

subject: What to do with these when compiling/adding function stubs?
content: Probably has an obvious answer, but my brain is still melty from p2. When copying . . private:.     std::string rank;.     std::string suit;. };. From Card.h to Card.cpp (as specified in the spec), it says 'expected a declaration'. What should I do? Since these are just the private member variables
i_answer: You don't actually have to copy the member variables from a class definition in a header file! You only need to copy and implement member _functions_.  There's no need to implement a member _variable_; its definition in the .h file is enough.

subject: Card
content: I'm a little confused about the Effects clause of some of the operator functions in Card.cpp, such as: . "Returns true if lhs is lower value than rhs.". . If we had two cards Ten of Diamonds and Ten of Hearts, and Trump is Clubs, which would be the lower value in this case? In other words, what are we comparing in these functions?
i_answer: I would look at this part in the spec: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cardsYou’re comparing ranks and suits!

subject: Passing by reference in card.cpp
content: In the function declarations in card.h, why are the parameters trump and rank passed by reference? We are not gonna modify them, are we?
i_answer: Correct those parameters are not modifiable since they are passed in as references to const.  std::strings in general are passed in by reference to make the code more memory efficient.

subject: implementing operator functions
content: i was wondering if there is a better way than for loops to implement the operator function when considering rank and suits? and also was wondering if we need to consider suits' weight when comparing cards from different suits?
i_answer: Its fine to use loops, but you are welcome to find a more efficient way if you would like. Yes, you should consider the weights of the cards.

subject: Order of progression in Euchre
content: When starting out, is there an order that is recommended to complete the files or is it up to us to figure that out? I don't see any exact roadmap in the specs
i_answer: I think this section of the spec outlines a pretty good order to tackle this project: https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#implement-and-test-the-basic-euchre-adts. . Basically, implement and test the ADT's (Card, then Pack and Player) then implement the actual Euchre game which uses those ADT's.

subject: Gitlab Question
content: I have set a new project on GitLab and get everything done on my local end, but when I was trying to push the files I have on my local end to Gitlab, this happened: . . Then I tried to copy this code and paste it into my terminal, and it showed:. . Did anyone know what's going on here and how can I fix it? Thanks!
i_answer: Looks like you were unable to push your changes because your local code is not up to date with the code in your GitLab repo. You'll need to pull whatever changes you don't have locally then you can do the git push:. ```. git pull            <--- this command brings in your changes from the remote repo. git push --set-upstream origin main. ```. Let us know if you run into any other issues with git, or if this doesn't work!

subject: Player functions
content: I am setting up my functions for player.cpp, but I am unsure what functions to include. Do we include all of the public functions that are equalled to 0?
i_answer: From the spec:. . we’ll use the abstract base class Player to define an interface of players’ abilities and then implement a few derived classes that use different player strategies.. You will be implementing two types of Player:. . . “Simple”: A computer-controlled player that uses the basic strategy described earlier.. . “Human”: A human-controlled player that reads instructions from cin.. . To paraphrase you will be implementing two derived classes from the Player class.  Since Player is an abstract interface, the two derived classes you create must have functions that override each of Player's pure virtual functions.

subject: operator overloading in P3 card
content: To rewrite the operator, do we only compare the rank of the card or also consider the trump.
i_answer: From the effects clause of operator<:. . //EFFECTS Returns true if lhs is lower value than rhs.. //  Does not consider trump.. You should only be using the rank and the suit of a card to determine whether card lhs is less than card rhs

subject: Pack file
content: How are the two pack functions in pack.h do not have a function type? (like void or int) And what is (assert next) that is in the implementation of reset in the spec?
i_answer: Pack has a private member variable named "next", and before you write any function implementations, nothing will reference/use it. So if you try to compile, the compiler will throw an error saying "next is unused".. . To get around this (temporarily), you use in the statement "assert(next)". That way the compiler will recognize that the variable is being used, and will compile. Just be sure to remove it later when you write your Pack functions

subject: What is constexpr
content: In the starter files of project 3 the card ranks and suit are declared with the keyword "constexpr". What is this constexpr , and what effects does it have ?
i_answer: constexpr declares that a variable or function can be evaluated at compile time (before your program is run). These expressions must be of a literal type (kind of like a primitive but a bit more extensive), and their initialization must be a constant expression. You can read more about it here https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/constexpr

subject: functions inside Card.cpp file that are outside Card class
content: Hey I noticed that there are a few functions in the card.cpp file that are outside the card class, like the operator functions and suit_next. Why are they outside of the class? and can we implement them in another file?
i_answer: Operator functions take 2 inputs, the left-hand side of the operator and the right-hand side of the operator. If the operator was called as part of a class object, you would have to use operator "on" the specific class object instance (similar to how you would call a getter or setter like card.get_rank()), which is not possible since a comparison operator expects something on the left and something on the right.

subject: operator functions
content: Why am I getting this error? Shouldn't the operator functions be expecting only two parameters?. . .
i_answer: the overloaded operators are not member functions of the Card class.  So when implementing those functions in Card.cpp, get rid of the Card:: in each of those functions.

subject: Comparison Operators
content: The project spec (https://eecs280staff.github.io/p3-euchre/#value-of-cards) mentions that if 2 cards have the same rank, we should use the suit to break ties, where D > C > H > S. Should our comparison operators (>, <, >=, etc.) in Card.cpp use suit to break ties or should it just compare rank? If it should break ties, isn't < and <= redundant since there are no card duplicates and we'd never compare a card to itself?
i_answer: The comparison operators should use suit to break ties in the event that the rank of the cards is the same. To answer your second question, don't think too heavily about the "when," as that understanding will come later in the project as you work through other files. Instead, consider how varies operators can be used together to make the implementation of other operators more simple.

subject: Errors in Card.h
content: Getting an error in Card.h about the rank declarations and suit declarations, not sure how to handle it.
i_answer: My theory here is that VS Code is trying to interpret the code using a C++ version that doesn't include the `constexpr` keyword. To fix this, you need to change the C++ version that VS Code uses in its static analysis.. . To do this, go to the settings page (ctrl+, or cmd+,) then search "cpp standard" and select C++11 from the dropdown list.
